column2: Fix offset to work in ShadowDOM
column3: This pull request fixes 1784 issue Quick summary element contains and element compareDocumentPosition does not work with ShadowDOM and always treated as disconnected even if it in the tree element getBoundingClientRect work fine with elements in ShadowDOM returns correct values when element is in the tree and zeroes when not Behavior of getBoundingClientRect For hidden elements returns all zeros For disconnected elements return all zeros In IE8 throws error when uses with disconnected element What was made Added guard which returns dummy block when rect has only zeroes disconnected or hidden jQuery contains check was not removed since without it IE8 will throw error and hence we need to return early for IE8 if element is disconnected But because jQuery contains has no effect with ShadowDOM does not work as expected I added check for existence of ShadowDOM before calling jQuery contains so we do not rely on it when it does not work Questions Maybe it is better to move check of ShadowDOM existence to jQuery supports ShadowDOM and then use it pc mentioned in 1784 what he already made tests for offset in ShadowDOM I can made my own test or we can use his since they are already made If you decide to use his test then probable it is better what he will commint them by himself Also said in 1784 I do not like this conflation of unrelated behaviors About this line of code if elem createShadowRoot jQuery contains docElem elem I agree with it but this check is more performant than tree traversal or try catch block Also it is not so much unrelated it is used to prevent use jQuery contains in situation when it does not work and by the way prevents IE8 to fail

column2: No error or other indication that getScript did not execute script sent with MIME text plain
column3: This gist just makes an alert call I'm trying to run it with getScript jsbin console The console dutifully shows Script loaded and the Network tab shows indeed that the request to gist github com returned the script The problem is the script wo not ever execute Now we know that GitHub returns Content Type text plain and sets no sniff so failure to execute is not entirely surprising but I think the fact that success is called can be misleading data being undefined is not an indicator because data is undefined even if the script executes jsbin console This raises a separate issue what exactly is data supposed to contain It is not the body of the script nor its result apparently the script called by the second JSbin returns finished but the console still shows undefined

column2: Consider not eval ing responses to cross domain queries
column3: Currently if client side code does get url or getJSON url and url is a cross domain URL by default JSON will look at the URL and the Content Type of the response to guess what protocol to use Under certain conditions e g the URL contains or or the Content Type of the response is Javascript jQuery will auto guess that JSONP should be used and will automatically eval the response to the query This behavior is dangerous and can introduce XSS vulnerabilities It is also potentially unexpected if the caller does not explicitly set dataType to jsonp or script it might be surprising and unexpected that get getJSON ajax can eval the response from the server At present I can imagine it might cause subtle XSS vulnerabilities in deployed code that uses jQuery I think it would be worth considering whether it is possible to change this automatic behavior A good principle might be Do not eval the response from a cross domain server unless the developer has requested that or could reasonably anticipate that it would happen Of course backwards compatibility with existing jQuery code is going to be a challenge I do not know whether there is a good way to thread the needle between 1 backwards compatibility with existing code and 2 creating traps for the unwary where code that looks entirely reasonable is actually a XSS vulnerability But perhaps it is possible for jQuery to be just a bit smarter For instance when the developer calls getJSON and does not explicitly set dataType to jsonp could jQuery use JSON parse instead of eval Is it feasible to disable the auto JSONP or step back from it a bit at least for cross domain queries Lacking data on usage of jQuery APIs I do not know what might be possible but this smells like an area where some changes to jQuery is behavior might help developers avoid getting bit by subtle XSS bugs See e g and and all the usual resources about the security risks of eval on untrusted code

column2: jQuery Ajax Basic Authentication opts username opts password not sending auth headers
column3: The only method to do basic authentication with the jQuery Ajax module is to set the header yourself in beforeSend Using the opts username and opts password simply does not put an authentication header at all in the request Even though pre baked url auth user pass example com is a browser convention it would be nice to support this feature as well This SO answer talks about the problem with the username and password options and I have confirmed their findings Tested with jQuery 1 11 2 Chrome Firefox I noticed on line 8875 of the built jQuery unminified source that the username and password options were commented out I realize this is not the only spot that defines how they are implemented but just noticing this The request to the API server allowed cross origin requests and I am using the npm cors package Enabling pre flight enabling cors pre flight or playing with some of the other configuration options configuration options had no effect on the responses Although this is expected because the auth headers were not being sent by jQuery Ajax

column2: DOMContentLoaded handlers fail to fire after jQuery is loaded Opera only
column3: There is some weird interplay between jQuery and standard DOMContentLoaded listener registration This issue only manifests in Opera only tested with 27 0 1689 76 on Mac It does not appear to affect either stable or dev channels of Safari Chrome or Firefox jQuery itself does not need to be used at all and in fact is not even used in the test case Simply including jQuery in the page at a specific point causes the error Removing jQuery fixes the issue Steps to reproduce 1 Add a standard DOMContentLoaded listener that 1 removes itself as event listener file kill domcontentloaded js L2 2 appends an iframe file kill domcontentloaded js L3 2 include jQuery jquery must be loaded after the DOMContentLoaded listener per above 3 register any other DOMContentLoaded listeners These listeners will never fire These listeners can be registered before or after jQuery is loaded it does not matter As long as both jQuery and these listeners are loaded after the offending listener no 1 above then they will fail to fire Minimal test case uses this gist file kill domcontentloaded js for the offending DOMContentLoaded listener step 1 above Then includes jQuery Then uses the JS pane to register an additional DOMContentLoaded listener which never fires Minimal test case using jQuery 1 11 3 Minimal test case using jQuery 2 1 4

column2: show can break responsive stylesheets
column3: Originally reported by sten paa at p When show is called the em computed em display value is cemented as an inline style This can cause inconsistent behavior p p Fiddle a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a p p Note that in the fiddle I use JavaScript to change the 'layout' This simulates what would happen if the tt display inline tt style were applied conditionally based on a responsive media query That is a given block of code could produce different results based on something like the orientation of a device and when the device orientation really the viewport width changed with respect to when the show hide calls are made p p I understand that based on the fact that an inline style is applied at the point when show is called that the browser is rendering the styles properly The 'bug' I suppose comes in the fact that a dynamic computed value is assumed to be ok to translate to a more fixed inline style p p Resolution may involve finding a way to 'clean up' the inline style at the end of show and allow all styles not provided by jQuery to continue doing exactly what they were before show hide were invoked p p Issue reported for jQuery 1 11 0 p

column2: visible hidden selectors unreliable
column3: Issue This issue is present in both version 1 and 2 of jQuery It is happening on inline elements wrapping block elements which is valid in HTML5 such as a header and an image wrapped in a single anchor Two issues arise 1 Different browsers report offsetWidth Height of the anchor differently For example Firefox would report one visible anchor in the example below and Chrome will report 0 This also highly depends on the CSS styles applied as on the page where this issue was discovered missing images are not displayed at all instead of the common missing image icon 2 While a browser may report an anchor as invisible child elements are still visible and clickable as they inherit anchor properties Example Solution There are 2 potential solutions that come to mind but each has flaws 1 Loop through child elements and check each for visibility Potentially harmful for performance although the selector is already marked as such in the documentation 2 Check parent for visibility Probably not enough on its own as it will report incorrectly if anchor does not have visible children

column2: Standardize invalid input behavior
column3: Many jQuery collection operations are only meaningful on elements or somewhat less commonly DOM nodes but the collections can logically contain anything Such operations should always assume valid input potentially throwing exceptions when they encounter an invalid member especially given the ease of manually cleaning like collection filter Single member read e g attr name css name offset Whole collection read e g hasClass clazz Whole collection write e g attr name val css props offset n addClass clazz Special consideration is warranted for single member reads responding to empty collections Current behavior usually returns undefined which seems reasonable to standardize on including changing those methods that return null like scrollTop and width There are cases where this collides with real output but such collisions seem to be sane el css unknownProperty el prop nonexistent hasNoData data etc Related 2114 2115

column2: Strange behavior with iframes title cased CSS and Chrome Webkit
column3: Migrated from Thread Long story short I'm working on a project that is using jQuery to write DOM nodes to an iframe and I found some odd behavior with CSS classes containing capitalized characters I have narrowed it down to what seems to be an issue with jQuery is append function for wrapped HTML and it affects all versions of jQuery 1 x and 2 x Chromium Webkit based browsers only See the following JSFiddle using Google Chrome or Safari for the minimal test case Hopefully the comments are pretty self explanatory but as you can see I have a basic CSS class called TitleCase that will color text red I generate a simple div with this class name and add it to the DOM via append html markup here If I then try to append another DOM node containing that same class name to an iframe it breaks styles from that class in the parent DOM in other words the style definitions disappear There are a bunch of odd workarounds for this that seem to suggest this might be a bug with jQuery Workarounds Applying a setTimeout to delay the iframe manipulation Giving the affected DOM element additional CSS class names or dummy attributes Resorting to lowercase CSS class names Manually removing and re adding the class name to the DOM elements Passing a string directly to append Using another non jQuery method to generate the element and append it I suspect the problem lies in how jQuery is append method treats HTML text VS a jQuery object but i have not been able to pinpoint exactly why from jQuery is source code

column2: In ie11 when many dropdowns on a page throwing out of stack error related to caching
column3: Hi Recently the document mode for our application has been upgraded from IE8 to Edge This has been achieved with a simple change of content attribute for meta tag in Head cshtml meta http equiv X UA Compatible content IE edge The application is working as expected for most of the pages but breaks where many dropdowns are rendered The dropdown Kendo UI Dropdown lists the record however does not let the user to select a value In the console you can find the error as SCRIPT28 Out of stack space This issue can be replicated for IE 10 There are three solutions which I came across that allowed the application to run smoothly Keep the IE developer tool F12 opened Uncheck option Disable script debugging in IE Update the jQuery core library jquery 1 11 0 at line 3857 elem elem nodeType jQuery cache elem jQuery expando elem jQuery expando with elem elem jQuery expando With the first two options the error still persists in console But the dropdown are working properly But with the last solution the error goes away totally I have also tried updating the jQuery versions to 1 11 3 and 2 x but nothing helped Please provide some technical assistance Regards Kriti

column2: If a callback throws an error all subsequent calls to fire are ignored
column3: See still exists in 2 1 4 This is a similar problem as in 1823 except that it refers to the Callbacks API When using the Callbacks API a callback added with add that throws an error on fire breaks all subsequent fire calls and remaining listeners in the 1st fire call are ignored too Maybe you could introduce an option to control the exception handling e g onError ignore log throw throwCombined The current behavior completely breaks the Callbacks object so at least the call should be surrounded with try catch to cleanup before rethrowing firing false

column2: Ajax requests with binary data throw errors in Chrome
column3: Originally reported by cbroome at p This is related to issue a class closed ticket href title bug jQuery ajax always fails when requesting JPG images in IE closed fixed 11426 a p p Code starting at line 8598 p pre class wiki complete xhrSuccessStatus xhr status xhr status xhr statusText Support IE9 Accessing binary data responseText throws an exception 11426 typeof xhr responseText string text xhr responseText undefined xhr getAllResponseHeaders pre p In that ticket the fix was to throw an exception for IE browsers however Chrome v36 throws an exception as well when accessing xhr responseText I'm not advocating jquery handling binary data as another ticket left that for the plugins What I would like to see is the conditional p pre class wiki typeof xhr responseText string pre p changed to something safer p pre class wiki xhr responseType text amp amp xhr responseText string pre p Or something similar so long as that check does not throw an exception As it is the current state prevents launching the 'complete' callback for any binary data response even though 'text' is an inessential parameter defaulted to undefined p p Thanks p p Issue reported for jQuery 2 1 1 p

column2: Select Element using val setting option to blank when wrong value passed
column3: As per the latest HTML5 specs it clearly stats that if the value setting to an select element that does not exists than it should point to first option But after 1 9 1 release this behaviour is not working Latest HTML5 Specs Url the select element If nodes are inserted or nodes are removed causing the list of options to gain or lose one or more option elements or if an option element in the list of options asks for a reset then if the select element is multiple attribute is absent the select element is display size is 1 and no option elements in the select element is list of options have their selectedness set to true the user agent must set the selectedness of the first option element in the list of options in tree order that is not disabled if any to true There are older tickets related to this issue but they are marked closed stating 1 9 1 had inconsistent behaviour jsFiddle Url

column2: on vs addEventListener multiple identical event listeners
column3: If we attach the same event listener multiple times with jQuery is on it will be attached multiple times If we attach the same event listener multiple times with the native addEventListener it will be attached only once Demo console output I would prefer jQuery is on to work as the native addEventListener and discard the subsequent attaches of the same event listener

column2: Handlers ability to specify order of execution
column3: Some event systems like ZF2 EventManager have ability to specify order or priority of handlers execution Currently in jQuery it is impossible to execute handlers in order different from the one they were attached in without hacking the internals Do you think order of execution is something that could land in jQuery Without breaking BC priority should be put before or after all arguments so

column2: Support for cross domain Patch requests using IE10 IE11 broke between 1 10 2 and 1 11 1
column3: jQuery versions 1 6 0 1 10 2 provided support for making cross domain Patch requests in IE10 and IE11 using the jQuery ajax method assuming all client and server settings are configured correctly for CORS That support broke beginning with jQuery 1 11 1 rc1 A properly configured ajax request in IE10 11 now fails with Error Could not complete the operation due to error 8070000c Stepping through the relevant jQuery code shows the underlying error being thrown as 2146828218 Permission denied The breaking change appears to be occurring in the newly added condition get post head put delete options i test this type where the code is determining which type of xhr object to use A complete description including code snippets can be found at I would be happy to provide a jsFiddle link showing 1 10 2 vs 1 11 1 support if that link can be shared privately Regards John

column2: Set width issue if value in percentage and the element uses box sizing border box and has border set in pixels
column3: Hi Sorry if the issue name is a bit long and obscure but it did not manage to describe that bug properly I could reproduce this issue with the following jQuery versions 1 11 3 1 10 2 For the demo purpose I use JSFiddle that uses jQuery 1 11 0 Let is imagine this HTML structure The alert will output 65 this 65 is an addition of 50 15 You can see a working demo of this issue on this JSFiddle I dug a little more and could determined that the problem comes from setPositiveNumber and augmentWidthOrHeight method It seems that augmentWidthOrHeight does not take in account that the border padding can have different unit compared to the content width I'm not sure what is the best way to fix that issue so that is why I create that issue instead of doing a pull request Feel free to ask questions Thanks for your hard work

column2: ajax empty response required by rfc but parse attempted
column3: when ajax response status code is 205 rfc requires empty body but jquery attempts to parse using the json converter and fails We know that parsing an empty string as json will fail but attempt to parse should not be made for 205 status code Surprisingly for 204 status code a parse attempt is still made but the inevitable errors on empty content are discarded Surely parsing should not be attempted when rfc disallows content

column2: jQuery animate sets it is own initial value when animating width to 0
column3: jQuery version 1 11 0 and 1 11 3 Observed in Chrome 43 IE 11 FF Developer 40 on Windows 7 64bit Originally posted on StackOverflow here JSFiddle Example broken JSFiddle Example fixed I'm working on an implementation for a sidebar that slides in from the left squashing the main content div as it goes As you can see from the demo sliding out works fine but when it comes to sliding back in again the sidebar div is set to 100 width before the animation starts causing a very jarring effect This is easier to see if you inspect the sidebar element and watch the width css property very carefully As Rory McCrossan on the StackOverflow thread points out replacing width 0 with width 0 solves the issue leading me to believe this may be a jQuery bug

column2: width height etc should not round
column3: Originally reported by john at p Right now we are rounding off the answers from width height etc to the nearest pixel this makes it hard to do good positioning of elements especially for animations For example if you have 3 items that are width 33 inside of a 100px element we are returning 33px for each element Theoretically an animation method might be able to return a more interesting result if they know that there are extra fractional numbers getting rounded off p p I got a report on this directly from Mozilla but I agree with them that this particular change makes it hard to get to good numbers p p See also a class closed ticket href title bug innerHeight outerHeight does not round up closed fixed 3239 a p p Issue reported for jQuery 1 6 1 p

column2: CSS Make css width css height return fractional values
column3: Fixes gh 1724 9 bytes most likely because the IE11 fullscreen workaround got way smaller Safari 8 returns 0 for gBCR width for table columns and non zero value for offsetWidth Older versions do not exhibit this behavior As for issuecomment 59852601 I can reproduce the problem only on jsFiddle so it may require an iframe or even weirder setup who knows But browsers not supporting fractional values in gBCR differ in what to return anyway e g Android Browser always rounds down same with offsetWidth I do not think we are going to get consistent data here IE 10 11 Edge return non decimal heights for children divs in dimensions tests so I had to round it The value is really close but smaller than 100 Tests pass on IE 9 11 Firefox Chrome Safari 6 8 Android 2 3 5 0 iOS 6 8 Should I add more tests Not sure what else can I check TODO x Perf tests jsPerf is down any other service x compat version of the patch they should be similar but IE8 needs special handling

column2: jQuery not added to window when required using browserify
column3: When installing jquery via npm and requiring it with browserify the intro js sets noGlobal flag to true resulting in jQuery not automatically being added as a property to the window object A common way of loading jquery plugins that are not available as commonjs modules into a browserify stack is to shim them using browserify shim and a configuration in the package json where jquery can be added as a dependency so whenever the plugin is required jquery is required aswell Most plugins will fail when required nevertheless because they require or jQuery properties on the window object which do not exist because noGlobal is set Whats the usecase of not adding and jQuery properties to the window object How can i solve this problem

column2: Remove or document jQuery fn push sort splice

column2: getAttribute call on document fragment
column3: Hello jquery community First of all Here is the demo All relevant output show is up in the browser is console Here is a screenshot that shows the line in jQuery where the problem happens You can see that elem is a document fragment selection 008 Source of the demo Can be found here Situation You have a delegate click event handler that targets elements by a specific attribute document on 'click' ' some attribute ' function You have a custom element that uses html5 templates to create a simple list of items Each item has a button to remove the parent item itself from the list What happens The click on a items button removes the element before the event reaches the jQuery event handler At the time the event arrives the item has been removed and placed in a document fragment Now jQuery tests the event selector on the document fragment and that fails of course I guess the fix would simply be to check if the element tested on the selector actually has a attribute api

column2: jQuery Truck Factor
column3: As part of my PhD research on code authorship we calculated the Truck Factor TF of some popular GitHub repositories As you probably know the Truck or Bus Factor designates the minimal number of developers that have to be hit by a truck or quit before a project is incapacitated In our work we consider that a system is in trouble if more than 50 of its files become orphan i e without a main author More details on our work in this preprint We calculated the TF for jQuery and obtained a value of 4 The developers responsible for this TF are Timmy Willison author of 34 of the files jaubourg author of 25 of the files John Resig author of 21 of the files Micha Go biowski author of 17 of the files To validate our results we would like to ask jQuery developers the following three brief questions a Do you agree that the listed developers are the main developers of jQuery b Do you agree that jQuery will be in trouble if the listed developers leave the project e g if they win in the lottery to be less morbid c Does jQuery have some characteristics that would attenuate the loss of the listed developers e g detailed documentation Thanks in advance for your collaboration Guilherme Avelino PhD Student Applied Software Engineering Group ASERG UFMG Brazil

column2: Improve when then for non ajax usage
column3: The following code is a simple example of then chaining as I would expect it to work In the documentation here the way Deferred is used in the non ajax example does not explain how I should structure the code below It also makes the code so complicated and ugly I may as well use traditional callbacks to clean up My suggestion is to let then handle a javascript promise as expected below The result is that both synchronous functions fire instantly instead of waiting for the previous async promises to resolve In addition if a promise is not returned the next then function should be called immediately Then I can unwrap the function from it is promise in functionSync I and many others are struggling with the bizarre terminology workflow and ugly code of the when feature Even if I have misunderstood everything the documentation needs to be improved

column2: Serialize handle arrays with null values
column3: Arrays with null values are treated as nested objects This causes something like foo bar null buzz to be serialized at foo bar foo 1 foo buzz when really it should be serialized as foo bar foo foo buzz This error is caused because javascript is typeof operator treats null as an object It might be worth reviewing sec 11 4 3 to make sure there are not other cases of other poorly typed entities causing similar problems

column2: Build Do not install jsdom 3 on Node js 0 10 0 12 by default
column3: jsdom 3 requires Python Visual Studio on Windows which is a significant barrier to contributors Newer jsdom versions do not require pre compiling but work only on io js This commit installs the new jsdom everywhere it does install in old Node js it just wo not work and executes Node related tests only on newer Nodes or if a working jsdom version is installed The latter can be achieved by running the old jsdom task Node js is merging with io js soon so this will become a smaller problem over time One drawback is our Jenkins setup runs on Node 0 10 so it wo not be running Node tests anymore We have Travis set up on io js though so all PRs have those tests run When the new LTS Node js arrives as it soon merges with io js we should update our Jenkins infrastructure so that it runs on this new version Fixes gh 2519

column2: Tests Add simple tests for Android 2 3
column3: Fixes gh 2505 Refs gh 2483 core This is an initial stab at simple tests for Android 2 3 but please review what I have before I write tests for other modules I have created a separate module called basic to contain those selected tests I also added it to the list run by regular browsers so that we immediately know if those tests are ok Note that tests are very basic but testing the whole API even without edge cases however you define them would be way too much if we run more than 10 of assertions in Android 2 3 it will be unstable older browsers fare better with many modules with few tests in them rather than one module with all I would rather remove some CSS tests from this list than add more I have temporarily modified our Jenkins jobs to see how that would look 1 the regular periodic run without Android 2 3 2 the basic run just for Android 2 3 Even these 18 CSS tests seem to sometimes run very slow on Android 2 3 they were running for 11 minutes timed out after restarting they passed almost immediately

column2: Switch support tests to use document documentElement instead of document body
column3: See issuecomment 125375758 I used document body for support tests in 1 11 because of test failures but it seems no longer to be a problem I'm able to run support tests in IE8 before document ready and they give correct result We can synchronize these code paths Refs gh 2133

column2: html uses a regular expression that performs badly in IE 9
column3: rnoInnerhtml script style link i The above causes significant performance issues in IE 10 IE 11 and EDGE when inserting large amounts of HTML using the html function It can be re written as the following rnoInnerhtml script style link i The above performs at the same level in other browsers and exponentially faster in IE My tests show for two columns for 4096 rows the difference is 18 seconds versus 5 milliseconds IE 11 Note when testing you the first test will always be slower than the second in chrome firefox Ticket logged at Microsoft however i think jQuery should be fixed anyways

column2: Manipulation Switch rnoInnerhtml to a version more performant in IE
column3: IE versions greater than 9 do not handle the old regular expression well with large html content This is due to the use of a non capturing group after a very common html character Test suite Microsoft bug Fixes gh 2563 Closes gh 2574

column2: ParseHTML removes content in Windows Store App
column3: tmp innerHTML removes certain content from the HTML to be parsed when used in a Windows Store App This is according to the security restrictions outlined here However this ruins functionality that is dependent on for example comments to work like the virtual element template binding in Knockout js This could be fixed by changing innerHTML with WinJS Utilities setInnerHTMLUnsafe when used in a Windows Store App

column2: Modify ajaxConvert to return a promise thenable
column3: The internal ajaxConvert function always returns synchronously This makes it impossible to support new techniques such as async JSON parse by defining custom converters Considering Ajax is already asynchronous ajaxConvert is in an unreachable private scope I propose that we modify ajaxConvert to return a promise thenable If this is considered beneficial I will have a patch up with tests this week

column2: jQuery does not reliably trigger events added with addEventListener
column3: jQuery 2 x still has code from 1 x around that attempts to trigger native custom browser not the events added with on events when you call trigger For backwards compatibility it uses the on event accessor This does not reliably expose event handlers added with addEventListener though even though some browsers expose the handler for some events As jQuery 2 x does not care about APIs from the stone age any more it would be great if you instead triggered dispatchEvent so that jQuery APIs play nice with non jQuery APIs References There is a reproducer for jQ 2 1 4 at There was a bug report several years ago at There is a StackOverflow that nicely describes an instance of the problem at I should mention we encountered this issue when we tried to marry JSON Editor with jQuery Mobile on a select element It turns out jQuery Mobile manipulates the select DOM node then calls trigger 'change' whereas JSON Editor listens for DOM changes using addEventListener

column2: Use element matches for event delegation
column3: jQuery is event delegation is based on jquery event handlers method which is for handler filtering If developer uses event delegation on event selector fn everytime when event dispatches jquery event handlers calls jQuery selector gets a collection of delegated targets then checks them one by one The mechanism is basically same as my event delegation implementation based on querySelectorAll But another implementation based on element matches is times faster Would jQuery consider using matches instead

column2: dataFilter should be invoked before error callback
column3: ajax method is are invoked in this order 1 beforeSend 2 error 3 dataFilter 4 success 5 Promise callbacks 6 complete dataFilter is invoked after error callback To prevent JSON vulnerabilities we return prefixed JSON for both error and success responses But since the dataFilter is not invoked before error we end up with responseText property only and no responseJSON property that contains the parsed response object For example dataFilter should be invoked before the error callback so we can strip out the prefix and response is correctly parsed This is the case for the current versions 1 11 3 and 2 1 4

column2: Attributes Allow add remove toggle hasClass class name
column3: Many times it is useful to declare a class once and reuse it throughout a piece of code e g plugins However this is not possible currently since addClass removeClass toggleClass and hasClass do not accept class names which include the dot while and most tree traversing methods either accept or require it I think it would be beneficial to allow these other methods to accept class names which include the dot

column2: Document references to PRs and Issues
column3: When referring to Github tickets and PRs we use the common gh notation references for Github tickets and PRs We want to avoid using notatation entirely in commits and issues to avoid confusion between the two trackers and to avoid Github accidentally linking refs to our old tracker In our meeting this week we had discussed using trac 12344 notation For commits we can either use the short trac 12344 notation or the full URL Ref

column2: floating point missing in width
column3: Some element lets call it EL1 may have real width as floating point number for example if the element is width is set by CSS as 25 of parent element which is 345px our EL1 will have 86 25px width When I want to set another element lets call it EL2 to be the same width as EL1 I can use el2 width el1 width However jquery is width function returns integer instead of floating point number Jquery rounds the width In most cases this is not any problem but I noticed that sometimes when the EL1 width is some particular fraction jquery returns a number which results in EL2 rendeded one pixel off compared to EL1 Can be jquery made that it returns floating point widths as like the browser internally uses in order to get consistent results all the time Because if browser accepts floating point widths but jquery rounds it it sometimes leads to wrong behavior

column2: Add basic tests for Android 2 3 on master drop full support

column2: Reduce Android 2 3 support on master was Investigate Android 2 3 support
column3: We are already not fully supporting Android 2 3 The hard truth is we have never fully supported Android 2 3 First of all our unit tests do not pass there in a couple of modules There are serious AJAX issues with error handling 1786 2458 2458 seems pretty serious see issuecomment 119572119 there are manipulation issues with checked radios 1785 Even though most of the tests pass we cheat a little by putting Android 2 3 in special paths in some of them 1 L1507 L1512 2 L408 L413 3 L419 L426 L440 L444 4 L236 L254 Maintenance cost There are various problems that happen only on Android 2 3 e g now it turns out it does not allow unquoted reserved words as property names exactly as our favorite IE8 2478 It happens quite often that something just does not work e g currently for some reason AJAX tests hang very near the beginning Surprisingly it works on compat Lots of hours are being constantly put into making this browser work with our tests Market share When we released the last stable version of jQuery 2 1 I'm omitting patches a year and a half ago Android 2 3 still had a very large market share Currently Google stats show it at 5 6 of all Android versions this is not a mobile market share but Android market share Real percentage might be a little higher as it is counted via Google Play Store but it is still not that large as it was back then Size Cutting Android 2 3 support see an experimental branch that does it saves 186 bytes gzipped most of which are the reliableMarginRight support test and a workaround Making all tests pass would add more Resolution There are a couple ways to solve the problem 1 Do not change anything try to make Android 2 3 finally pass continue to suffer 2 Drop support from master but keep it on compat still suffer although a little less for some reason Android 2 3 problems happen more often on master than compat 3 Support Android 2 3 only partially ensure it parses jQuery correctly run a few basic tests ensuring most important APIs work on most common inputs Do not care for perfect compliance less suffering but such smoke testing may not be effective also it is hard to draw the line what is important and what is not 4 Drop support from both branches redirect people still needing support to the 1 x 2 x jQuery lines cc core

column2: jQuery param semantically incorrectly handles boolean properties
column3: Boolean values can not be passed to query string explicitly Because of it jQuery param turns boolean properties of input object to strings true is turned to 'true' and false is turned to 'false' For example jQuery param foo true bar false returns 'foo true bar false' In most cases server side scripts do not have ability to check whether query variable was originally boolean or string and auto conversion to boolean turns both 'true' and 'false' to true It would be great if jQuery param handles boolean properties like HTML checkbox element does returns on or 1 if the state is true and '' empty string if the state is false For example jQuery param foo true bar false would return 'foo 1 bar '

column2: Guard jQuery extend against non object arguments especially strings
column3: Hi When calling the extend method and passing a string as argument the string is split and character positions are added as property keys with the corresponding characters as values 2015 10 04 12 56 10 Since the docs present the function as a way to mix objects I would never expect this kind of behaviour When passing a non object argument which can always happen when not having added some sort of check before calling extend I would expect it to be ignored skipped e g adding an integer is not reflected in the result of an extend operation 2015 10 04 13 05 02 Of course you can sell this as a feature but I would rather say this can cause hard to spot bugs Felix

column2: Inadequate dangerous jQuery behavior for 3rd party text javascript responses
column3: Because of this L18 every text javascript response gets executed Even if we made a request to another service CORS was created exactly to prevent this kind of behavior in JSONP arbitrary code execution So when we do get '' or like in Rails' jquery ujs a form is being sent automatically the attacker can respond us with text javascript and execute arbitrary code on our origin Demo get '' The fix is to not execute responses from 3rd party origins by default and make it an option Do not know who to cc to discuss it P S I would switch it off for same origin either because using subtle redirect to saving tricks we can redirect user to local JSONP endpoint and still get an XSS but those are much more sophisticated vectors

column2: Core Support Symbol wrapper objects in jQuery type
column3: In ECMAScript 2015 ES6 the native typeof operator returns symbol for Symbol primitives As it is possible to wrap symbols using the Object constructor symbols can be objects as well as any other primitive type in JavaScript and should be determined by jQuery type

column2: prop tabIndex returns wrong value JSBin example included
column3: Hello prop tabIndex behaves differently in JQuery 1 11 3 and 2 1 4 when Internet Explorer 11 is used This is true at least for images dom nodes of type img img that does not have an attribute tabindex explicitly given Please see also the playground example here output When changing the URL of the loaded jQuery version you can see that the tabIndex is different 0 vs 1 This is because of changes in attributes porp js file The propHook for tabIndex is different The current code line master and 2 1 stable show the code of propHooks tabIndex as follows I have seen that jQuery Compat 3 0 Alpha uses the 1 11 logic again Maybe it would make sense to move that kind of logic also into jQuery 2 3 as Internet Explorers are still supprted at least the newer ones starting from 9 upwards Best regards Alexander

column2: position function reports incorrect left offset under Chrome
column3: Test this under Chrome and other browsers you will see the code left code offset reported by code position code method is incorrect under Chrome The value of code left code offset under Chrome is the gap between lt html gt and lt body gt not the real left offset of the horizontally centered lt div gt This problem relates only with horizontally centered lt div gt s and can be fixed by calculating manually with the code marginLeft code value of the element is computed style and the gap between lt html gt and lt body gt Maybe this is due to a possible bug design choice of Chrome as there are also some discussion about it on StackOverflow But I think jQuery is supposed to deal with such difference between browsers

column2: removeAttr selected should not set property to false
column3: Originally reported by wchen at p a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a p p In Firefox the selected value is 1 In Chrome the selected value is 2 p p removeAttr has special handing for boolean attributes to set the corresponding DOM property to false a class ext link href L86 rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span L86 a p p Removing an attribute and setting the DOM property to false are very different In this case as specified a class ext link href dom option selected rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span dom option selected a setting the property to false means setting the dirtiness to true This changes how the option should react to selected attribute changes In the test case it means that adding the selected attribute at the end should not select the option p p Firefox respects the specified behaviour and does not select the second option p p Issue reported for jQuery 2 0 3 p

column2: ajax dataType iscript' pending indefinitely in case of error on jQuery 1 x
column3: With jQuery 1 x when a script request has some kind of error User not online DNS can not be resolved server responds with HTTP 503 etc the Promise is never resolved or rejected it stays pending indefinitely In jQuery 2 x it gets instantly rejected This can be worked around by attaching a timeout but users tend not to do that This causes lots of components to stall indefinitely when certain problems occur with the server or the user is connection Pending indefinitely when using jQuery 1 x on latest Chrome Be sure to test on an HTTP origin as otherwise Chrome might prevent the request for security reasons though those errors do not propagate either

column2: IE8 empty leaks children if they were attached via DocumentFragment
column3: Originally reported by simon at p tt empty tt does not cleanly remove the children which were attached via a DocumentFragment The issue is a bug in IE8 is and below tt Node removeChild tt p p Running this fiddle in Sieve demonstrates the problem IE8 sieve can not run jsfiddle you have to create a local html p p Minimal test case a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a p ul li press the button li li see that in Sieve the 10 elements are still in memory 'orphaned' althought the container was emptied a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a li ul p The issue is resolved by using tt Node removeNode true tt You can test the effect of tt removeNode tt in the fiddle by setting tt USE DESTORY true tt reloading and pressing the button again the elements no longer leak p p As this test case demonstrates the issue can be resolved by using tt Node removeNode false tt in IE8 instead of tt Node removeChild tt for example here a class ext link href L195 rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span L195 a p p Additionally the dojo source documents this IE8 bug right here a class ext link href L329 rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span L329 a p p Issue reported for jQuery 1 9 1 p

column2: JSONP error handler for cross origin requests is triggered only after timeout
column3: Originally reported by ri joel at p The JSONP error handler is triggered for HTTP errors e g 404 for same origin requests immediately but for cross origin requests only after the timeout occurred This can be easily fixed with adding script onerror see Zepto js p p a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a p p Tested browsers Affected Chrome 26 Firefox 20 Safari 6 Opera 12 14 Not affected IE 9 p p I will provide a patch later p p Issue reported for jQuery 1 9 1 p

column2: IE Edge taking an unusually long time to create many elements
column3: Update jsfiddle v4 One of my sites dissects text input an tries to explain it Depending on the length of text you can end up with several thousand elements This functions lightning fast in Chrome and Firefox but IE stalls while trying to create the elements when there are many of them The problem is not rendering the elements but the actual creation as my demo will show As in all browsers the two tests take comparable time per browser As the limit of the loop approaches 10 000 Edge is more likely to stall out which is what I'm seeing a lot of in my website At 1 000 it just takes a few seconds At 2000 Edge takes 16 seconds in each of the two tests Chrome and Firefox handily 10 000 in four seconds After more than five solid minutes of waiting on Edge for 10 000 passes I closed the process where chrome did it in less than 5 seconds This is strange because Edge does many things much quicker than IE did Frequently its speeds rival or exceed Chrome and Firefox A sample run across the browsers mentioned has these results The first number is the test that renders to the screen the second number populates a jQuery created element

column2: Accept 202 HTTP Header
column3: Currently jQuery ajax only supports HTTP status 204 or 304 to not contain response contend but there are few more HTTP codes which might or might not contain response body such as 202 Accept status When no body is found for any other responses codes than 204 or 304 jQuery ajax expects content body and throws an exception SyntaxError Unexpected end of input at Object parse native at jQuery parseJSON while trying to parse undefined content data I think additional HTTP status codes should be included as optionally having no response body or it should depend on Content Length header and not try to parse data when header is set to Content Length 0

column2: Check document readyState interactive on document ready
column3: L81 As the comment mentioned IE9 will probably give an incorrect interactive readyState But that only affects IE9 Should interactive be accepted on other browsers I'm using require js to load my scripts and exactly jQuery and many other scripts are loaded after DOMContentLoaded but before fully loaded Scripts depending on document ready have to wait until load event is triggered Currently I use code document readyState interactive init document ready init code to get around this problem L16 This is another implementation of domReady which accept interactive readyState on browsers excluding IE Is there any reason why jQuery does not do that

column2: Core use interactive to evaluate dom ready
column3: Now that dom ready is always synchronous we do not have to deal with ensuring sync execution order I actually could not reproduce the IE9 issue where DOM below scripts is not actually interactive but I ran into a different issue with IE10 I think it was mostly a test issue but it had to do with document write behaving differently so I did not mess with it Either way I just kept the proposed solution of checking doScroll effectively excluding IE9 10 Fixes gh 2100

column2: New Feature Attributes provide a list of classes when given a selector
column3: This is my first attempt at contributing to jQuery apologies if I have missed a step I have read over the contribution guidelines and I would like to open a discussion on adding a jQuery classList function in the attributes module I assumed jQuery had a function to list all classes when given a selector until I needed the functionality this morning and stumbled upon this stackoverflow post This functionality would be easy to build in and I believe it would add value to the users who for whatever reason need to loop through classes held by an object I have some questions about what would be the most appropriate output Given a selector the function should return an array of classes for the attribute s 1 Should the output array have duplicates removed My feeling is that this would be more valuable than having duplicates If a user wants to know what classes fall under a selector I doubt they would be using it for duplicate entries Alternatively they could use unique to remove duplicate entries 2 Should the output be sorted in any way Does this functionality seem valuable

column2: Only change 20 to for application x www form urlencoded
column3: This resurrects trac 3400 which has the argument for the change Currently we always change encoded spaces 20 to the plus sign in jQuery param That is only correct behavior for posted form data but not other cases The conversion should be moved to jQuery ajax and only be done when the method is POST

column2: Ajax Only form encode requests with a body
column3: Fixes 2658 This is a minor behavior change for jQuery param and jQuery serialize since they no longer convert 20 to and for jQuery ajax when the data ends up on the URL I had some conflict trying to determine the right place to put this conversion If we want prefilters to see it this would have to be moved higher However the prefilters have the opportunity to change all kinds of stuff that might affect whether we do this at all So I decided to do it a bit further down once the hasContent variable is set and the content type is known Other suggestions welcome

column2: Data Feature detect and use Symbol if present
column3: JSPerf I have noticed that in much of my code Data key is often near the top of CPU time for initialization when hundreds or thousands of elements have their data initialized as is sometimes the case using ngAnimate in Angular By feature detecting the presence of Symbol and using it rather than a non enumerable property this function went from like 70 100ms CPU time to 0 3 since not only does it not have the overhead of define property but we can avoid the try catch in that codepath as well

column2: ajax load page fragment from XHTML gives error because of DOCTYPE XML declaration
column3: Trying to load a page fragment from a XHTML document fails giving a SyntaxError An invalid or illegal string was specified at least on Firefox This happ ens with the latest versions 1 11 2 and 2 1 3 It happens because the XHTML document has the XML declaration and the DOCTYPE I think if a regular HTML file has the DOCTYPE it will also fail If both are removed the XHTML fragment is loaded correctly By changing a few lines in the buildFragment function the problem goes away fix works on both versions Change tmp innerHTML wrap 1 elem replace rxhtmlTag 1 2 wrap 2 To regex first removes processing instructions second the DOCTYPE var rProcessingInstructions w gi var rDOCTYPE DOCTYPE gi tmp innerHTML wrap 1 elem replace rxhtmlTag 1 2 replace rDOCTYPE replace rProcessingInstructions wrap 2

column2: CommonJS avoid a global with a custom window passed to the factory
column3: In a CommonJS scenario these lines L26 L32 may result in one of 2 things 1 window window document exists the exported thing is a jQuery using window the global is not set 2 otherwise when a custom implementation is passed to the factory require jquery window the noGlobal flag is not passed global is created I thought for a moment we might want to pass along the second parameter but IMO we should just set it to true in such a case without asking for anything After all if someone invokes then it is trivial to attach it to the window by ourselves if needed The fact that we behave differently in CommonJS based on the initial setup worries me

column2: Select multiple will return null when no values returned
column3: I have just been looking into an issue whereby if you have a select element with the multiple option set and no options selected val will return null rather than an empty array If one more more items are selected then it returns an array I would have expected that an empty array would have been returned in this case This fiddle shows the issue IT appears all the way back to jQuery 1 2 where multiple value support was added The reason an empty array is not returned is the check for elem selectedIndex being 0 here L87 While I understand that for a single select I do not while get why that would be done for a multi select Removing index 0 would allow the empty array to be returned Having said that I'm not really expecting this change to be made as I guess a number of sites will depend upon this behaviour I'm more wondering if someone might be willing to say why it is done this way I have searched this issue tracker and the bugs jquery com site but could not find any mention of it

column2: Make event triggering a separate module
column3: If a custom build does not need manually triggered events it could save a bunch of bytes by removing jQuery event trigger jQuery event simulate jQuery fn trigger and jQuery fn triggerHandler This would mostly be useful for the 2 x now 3 x master branch because the 1 x 3 x compat branch relies pretty heavily on manually triggered events to fix up IE8 On master manual triggering is used to create bubbling focusin out events and fire ajax events but there are other approaches devs can use for both situations

column2: Have window outerWidth include the scrollbar width
column3: Originally reported by antti at p It is sometimes annoying that window width or window outerWidth do not include the scrollbar width in their value Especially when trying to match the window width to the CSS media queries p p Currently e g if you have a media query in the CSS such as p pre class wiki media screen and max width 1600px body background red pre p When the red background is actually applied to the document by the browser jQuery tells the window width is less than 1600px 1600 scrollbar width p p This is annoying e g in cases where there are some mobile specific stuff that needs to be done in both CSS and JS And they would need to be done at the exactly same width of the document window p p However plain JavaScript returns 1600 as the window width when asked at the point of the breakpoint as follows p pre class wiki console log window innerWidth pre p Is it possible to get either window width or windor outerWidth working consistently with the browser is actual width document width and 'body' width will not return the same as window innerWidth either they return the same as window width and window outerWidth p p Fixing this would greatly help making consistent code with the CSS media queries p p Possible workarounds currently are p ul li Using plain javascript i e window innerWidth li li Checking ' ' is ' visible' for some element that is visible only in the target width li ul p Here is an example of what I mean a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a p p Issue reported for jQuery 2 1 0 p

column2: Problem with the context when loading a script in an iframe
column3: Originally reported by jjgcastela at p When you create a script node and append it to a head or a body of an iframe the code is evaluated in the main window where the jQuery was loaded instead of in the window of the iframe I have been able to solve it adding the desired wouldocument' as the second argument of the 'globalEval' function this way p pre class wiki globalEval function code doc var script indirect eval code jQuery trim code if code If the code includes a valid prologue position strict mode pragma execute code by injecting a script tag into the document if doc amp amp doc document code indexOf use strict 1 if doc doc document script doc createElement script script text code doc head appendChild script parentNode removeChild script else Otherwise avoid the DOM node creation insertion and removal by using an indirect global eval indirect code pre p And then in the wouldomManip' function adding this parameter in the call to 'globalEval' p pre class wiki jQuery globalEval node textContent replace rcleanScript doc pre p Issue reported for jQuery 2 0 3 p

column2: JQuery 2 4 1 async problem
column3: This is apparently an old issue but there is a new wrinkle Like others have reported on various sites e g StackOverflow they will occasionally get this JQuery error message Synchronous XMLHttpRequest on the main thread is deprecated because of its detrimental effects to the end user is experience For more help check In my case the offending code was in the JQuery 2 1 4 file xhr open options type options url options async options username options password The relevant information at states Developers must not pass false for the async argument when the JavaScript global environment is a document environment I could not find use of xhr open in any of my own JQuery so I looked in the JQuery source file itself And there I found the source of the problem jQuery evalUrl function url return jQuery ajax url url type GET dataType script async false global false throws true Having async set to false triggers the console log error on my browsers By changing it to true the problem i e the console error disappears Is there a reason why this is set to false when the specs say that doing so is now bad practice as the feature is being deprecated

column2: Do not overwrite fn
column3: Not sure if it is open yet but could you please do not dumb overwrite fn It is very bad if the jQuery object gets overwritten and all registered plugins are gone Some CMS plugins using jQuery and they do not use noConflict and maybe overwriting each other For example they include code from a CDN and all registered plugins before are gone forever It is the user developer problem if the jQuery object gets overwritten with another version but losing plugins is unacceptable

column2: Remove single promiseable exception in jQuery when
column3: From If a single Deferred is passed to jQuery when its Promise object a subset of the Deferred methods is returned For consistency we should always create a new master Deferred We follow through but the code both ours and library consumers is more complicated than it needs to be as a result The upcoming major version bump is a chance to unify single and multiple argument calls to jQuery when if we agree that doing so is valuable we did not

column3: This was hard to trace but while working on a Drupal project I discovered what appears to be a bug with the rxhtmlTag regex in jQuery 2 1 4 This is the string I have been using to reproduce the issue div id edit target LYD5DGUO bk class dropzone enable div input data upload path media dropzonejs upload token FrxOvLt4PMXWr ldZ7IeEiyt5vbMy1 hfvQ8cgSs4cY data drupal selector edit target uploaded files type hidden name target uploaded files value And for reference here is the rxhtmlTag regex from jQuery Running string replace rxhtmlTag 1 2 as jQuery does in html will change the string thusly div id edit target LYD5DGUO bk class dropzone enable div div input data upload path media dropzonejs upload token FrxOvLt4PMXWr ldZ7IeEiyt5vbMy1 hfvQ8cgSs4cY data drupal selector edit target uploaded files type hidden name target uploaded files value Note a the addition of an extra lt div gt right before input data upload path and b the closing slash of edit target has been removed I'm not sure if this is by design but in my use case it is wreaking havoc I do not know how to fix it I have never debugged jQuery core before so I'm deferring to the experts Let me know if I can provide any additional information that might help this get fixed

column2: Nodes created by src css support js can break the DOM in some PhantomJS environments
column3: jQuery inserts a div L10 into the DOM on page load which is appended to html This element is subsequently removed but the DOM is in an invalid state in the interim since div tags are not valid outside of the body This is an issue for web crawlers using PhantomJS as the results of the html may be recorded before the element has been removed resulting in broken html We are experiencing this issue with our single page app at When a crawler visits the site PhantomJS loads the requested page and served the generated html to the crawler To reproduce spoof your user agent string to Googlebot 2 1 and visit the site Using your browser is developer tools to inspect the DOM you can see that all of the tags meta et al that belong in the head are nested within the body Looking at the source we can see the culprit is a rogue div inserted after html Using MutationObserver and debugger I have pinpointed it to the div appended by jQuery Appending it to the body will not maintain compatibility with all environments in my tests body does not always exist when this element is appended Most crawlers allow you to blacklist elements by selector but I have not had luck in this case html div should work but does not My suggestion is to add a discrete selector to this element to allow it to be easily blacklisted I am thinking of submitting a PR to address this issue using a data attribute as a selector supported by PhantomJS as well as IE7 avoids collisions with IDs classes that may be in the wild Let me know if you have any thoughts or if this issue is even worth addressing

column2: html does not return dynamically created markup as expected
column3: This seems like unexpected behaviour to me but let me know if I'm mistaken I traced it to a couple different things The dynamically created markup ends up being an array of elements then in html this 0 is referenced which only refers to the first element in the array hence the inner html for only the first element is returned Seems like there are a few ways to fix this check if this length 0 and then either return the outer html for each element in the array not very nice or create a fake element div for example append this to the element and return that inner html nicer but still not that great or possibly something else I'm not thinking of I'm not too familiar with all the code around this so I'm sure I'm missing some edge case scenario I'm able to workaround this issue through other means just thought it seemed odd

column2: outerWidth documentation possibly incorrect
column3: According to outerWidth docs outerWidth includeMargin The value reported by outerWidth is not guaranteed to be accurate when the element or its parent is hidden To get an accurate value ensure the element is visible before using outerWidth jQuery will attempt to temporarily show and then re hide an element in order to measure its dimensions but this is unreliable and even when accurate can significantly impact page performance This show and rehide measurement feature may be removed in a future version of jQuery Looking at the jQuery 1 11 3 source I see no specific show hide behaviour for outerWidth Is that functionality still there or has it been removed My own tests suggest that this is not happening but I wanted to check to make sure

column2: myForm trigger isubmit' when form contains an element named submit
column3: If you try to do something like input type submit name submit I see coders doing this all the time they are unoriginal and can not think of a better name for a submit button than submit so bare with me I think it would be good to address such users Then when calling myForm trigger isubmit' for the form which contains this element it will fail to submit in the same way which myForm submit fails since it will reference the element rather than the submit function of the form I believe jQuery should add a check when dealing with submit to verify it is indeed a function before calling it If not you can still submit the form by grabbing a copy of the function by creating a new form dynamically grabbing its submit method then sending the form we want to submit through this function document createElement 'form' submit call myForm We could also try to do something like myForm constructor prototype submit but then they might have an element named constructor in their form resulting in the same sort of issue So I believe creating an element for it would be a good solution to grab the submit method and apply it to the function we wish to submit

column2: audio trigger 'play' invokes playCallback twice
column3: Reposted from My stackoverflow post There is no satisfactory answer and I DO THINK THIS MAKES CODE BUG PRONE so I repost it here I used to think trigger play just fires the native play function of audio but today I just noticed that there is a slight difference between these two methods If you register a callback for play e g 'audio' on 'play' function console log 'playing' the callback will be invoked twice if you use trigger play but only once when using play How come this discrepancy Is this as expected I expect trigger 'play' to behave exactly the same as play Is it possible to make trigger play only fires the play callback once so as to keep potential bugs away demo In the demo I call trigger 'play' and trigger 'pause' and then play and pause The result is This demo could illustrate what I'm talking about This problem could be reproduced on Chrome version 46 0 2490 86 m IE 11 0 9600 18053 FireFox 42 0 One example problem is I want to addClass on a button in the playCallback and removeClass in the playingCallback When the audio is already playing If audio play is called neither playCallback nor playingCallback will be invoked If audio trigger 'play' is called the playCallback will be invoked ONCE and the playingCallback is not invoked This is an unexpected behavior

column2: undefine jquery in AMD environment when noConflict is called
column3: Hi Scenario An app is using requireJS for dependency management Also its using a nonAMD jquery plugin that needs jQuery on window to work which it specifies as dependency in the requireJS config The app has a tracking script say crazyegg installed too that loads its own jquery but in noconflict mode Issue Reduced testcase demo The tracking script loads and executes It registers jquery with requireJS but no jQuery or on window is put as its in noconflict mode All good requireJS loads our jquery plugin But since it has a dependency on jquery it tries to load jquery first But requireJS already has a jquery registered with it which tracking script did and so it does nothing No additional jquery is loaded which should have Now the plugin is loaded and since it expected jQuery on window and its not there it breaks Solutions noConflict method should also unregister jquery in the AMD environment Makes sense because noconflict is meant to remove any traces that the jquery library leaves on the website environment its loaded on OR Give another method for AMD noConflict which users can call separately If the jquery team agrees on either approach I can take this issue up

column2: MutationObserver fiering twice when using html
column3: I found the html method firing two MutationObserver Events I think cleanData and or empty are causing the first event on removal and the second event occures due to append and or innerHTML beeing called I think this is undermining the MutationObserver is basic idea to have only ONE event when a bunch of DOM changes take place right Is is technically possible to do these actions in one go Architectural considerations Well I am inbetween two chairs Personally I need to hook into both the add and removal event of a certain container currently replaced by the html method I was expection only one MutationObserver Event I think technically it would be nice to distigusih between these actions So what is the current way to do so That is reliable Are there any plans to make jquery distingush DOM add and removal events based on MutationObservers As far as I can see there are no MutationObservers used in jquery at all Regards O B

column2: css 'animation iteration count' 5 does not apply style to element
column3: When I use css 'animation iteration count' 5 I expect element has style webkit animation iteration count 5 this vendor prefix is just a example but it does not So I debug jQuery js I found when I use css 'animation iteration count' 5 actually become style 'WebkitAnimationIterationCount' 5 'px' Browser consider it a illegal value because animation iteration count only accept infinite number so this style do not have effect This is a reproduceBug demo So that cssNumber shoud add animationIterationCount property to prevent automatically add px to the value

column2: 2 2 Release progress
column3: Instead of porting bug fixes to 2 2 stable branch i decided to go with opposite way reverting back incompat commits I tried more conventional approach at first and another three too but it proved to me to be ineffective Since there was a lot more conflicts then with chosen approach which were prompted by the use of the new QUnit API and style fixes Below you find three lists one of the reverted commits and one of the questionable commits that are in 2 2 stable and are back compat but might be inappropriate for this release And also list of reverted commits which requires special attention I would expect from reviewers to check those lists and current state of the branch verifying that API does not include new features do not break back compat and done overall correctly Processed commits started from Oct 30 2014 Questionable commits Drop support for Opera 12 x Firefox 29 Safari 6 0 and old Blackberry Callbacks module change considered as a bug Hides jQuery swap Adds jQuery htmlPrefilter allowed by the semver for the minor version but might be inappropriate for this release also not documented Changes signature of the jQuery init needed for the Migrate cc Adds jQuery uniqueSort deprecates jQuery unique allowed by the semver for the minor version but might be not contracdict 2 2 release also not documented Hides jQuery domManip Hides jQuery buildFragment Changes signature remove additional param of jQuery event simulate could not find docs for it if documented is not acceptable change for the minor Hides jQuery acceptData Hides jQuery dir and jQuery sibling Even though subject of the commit reads Adding unit tests for jQuery Animation There was changes in logic and interface of the effects module cc Reverted commits Reason API change behaviour Name Ajax Always use script injection in globalEval Commit Issue trac 14757 PR Reason API change behaviour Name Effects Reintroduce use of requestAnimationFrame Commit Issue trac 15147 PR Reason Follow up commit for Name Effects Improve raf logic Commit PR Reason API change removed methods Name Deprecated Drop size and andSelf methods Commit Issue PR Reason Adherence to the latest version of execute only once Commit Issue PR Reason API change behaviour Name Callbacks Do not abort execution on lock Commit Issue PR Reason API change proprties removal Name Core Remove deprecated context and selector properties Commit Issue PR Reason API change return value Name Core Return empty array instead of null for parseHTML Commit Issue PR Reason API change return value Name Follow up commit for Name Deferred Backwards compatible standards interoperability Commit Issue PR Reason API change feature Name Wrap Support unwrap selector for selective unwrapping Commit Issue PR Note Could be column2: jQuery 2 2 0 has error from jQuery UI 1 11 4
column3: I have a web app that had jQuery 2 1 4 and jQuery UI 1 11 4 working fine Updated jQuery to 2 2 0 and then I started getting errors like datepicker is not a function or tabs is not a function Stepping thru in browser F12 I found the original JavaScript error in jquery 2 2 0 js elem is an lt a tag and its defaultView is null so view opener gives error Unable to get property 'opener' of undefined or null reference Looking up the callstack the top call is towards the beginning of jquery ui js at factory jQuery so none of my web app is code is directly involved No changes were made to my jQuery UI or jQuery Migrate libraries Rolling back to jQuery 2 1 4 got rid of the error for me I can duplicate this error with this simple jsFiddle example The Unable to get property error happens in Chrome and IE11

column2: when progress
column3: We currently do not have documentation for progress in when and there are some funky behaviors dmethvin proposed issuecomment 143330148 we drop the current progress pass thru and generate one progress notification for each resolved subordinate promise

column2: Deferred Remove undocumented progress notifications in when
column3: Fixes gh 2710 Although we could add a new feature to notify on the new Deferred once each thenable resolved rejected it seemed like that would encourage more Deferred specific behavior and I was not sure I wanted to go there The important 3 0 behavior change here is removing the notification pass through which was undocumented We can always add new functionality in a 3 x 0 if it is requested

column2: Add unhandled exception notices for Deferred
column3: Right now if there is an exception in a then it is silently swallowed I do not think we should ship 3 0 0 with that behavior console Maybe a console warn message We may end up yelling about rejections that might have been dealt with by a handler attached later in time One possible tradeoff would be to only generate the console warnings for errors that seem to be programming mistakes such as TypeError or ReferenceError That prevents the really bad mistakes such as the example above with a typo in a function name For more complex cases we could recommend that people use native Promise if it is consistently available across their supported platforms since it will be easier to debug

column2: Deferred Warn on exceptions that are likely programming errors
column3: Fixes gh 2736 Still a WIP with some details to be worked out I'm not really happy with the stack trace that results it is only showing the immediate prior call The gist however is that nearly all exceptions of these types are programming mistakes and should be reported ASAP If devs do not like being warned about them they can set jQuery Deferred exceptionHook null and not be bothered or define a custom hook that filters out the noisy false positives

Tripple negation and text nodes
column3: A while back A Wolff found an inconsistency in jQuery and posted it on StackOverflow I thought A Wolff would submit this issue but I can not find he did so here it is In short non element e g text nodes in recursive not and probably other pseudo selectors are treated differently for filter and not I dug into the issue and found the cause I'm not sure whether to consider this a bug or not but there is an easy fix in the answer to make it atleast consistent The cost of the fix is quite low

column2: Fix for 2808 inconsistent not filter
column3: Inconsistent ehaviour for non element nodes when using multiple recursive pseudo selectors on in not and filter Fixes gh 2808

column2: closest remove exception for pos selectors
column3: Further discussion here The documentation for closest states If no context is passed in then the context of the jQuery set will be used instead However it seems that this is often not the case You can see this illustrated here When the context is passed explicitly closest works as expected and only finds an element if it is within the context element However if the jquery set has a context and closest is called without explicitly passing a context no context is used contradicting the documentation However if the selector passed to closest contains non css selectors gt eq etc then the set is context is used I believe the fix should be to change the loop condition as follows for cur this i cur cur context cur cur parentNode should become for cur this i cur cur context this context cur cur parentNode which would be in line with the non css code which does a similar thing with context pos rneedsContext test selectors typeof selectors string jQuery selectors context this context 0

column2: Traversing Never let closest match positional selectors
column3: Fixes gh 2796 cf issuecomment 168841302 This changes a unit tested behavior but is not semver major since the behavior was undocumented Still it probably should be included in 3 0 just in case Also adds a test for the acceptance of non string input e g elem closest possibleParents Best viewed with w 2818 files w 1

column2: Hidden filter incorrectly includes visible elements
column3: All versions seem to get this wrong for inline elements For example anchors with images inside them on Chrome return an offsetWidth and offsetHeight of 0 This is likely because offsetWidth Height are based on a Working Draft Spec dom htmlelement offsetwidth which does not yet define a CSS Layout Box well css layout box and when it does only includes elements whose wouldisplay' property that is 'table column' or 'table column group' Since current implementations of offsetWidth Height on most browsers are much more performant than getClientRects getBoundingClientRect it makes since to use them but only when they return non falsy values A performant version of this function should be run
