column2: disabled selector inconsistent in different browsers
column3: When an input is disabled by its parent fieldset the disabled selector behaves differently in IE any version then other browsers In other browsers the disbaled selector will indicated an input disabled by a parent fieldset where in IE it will say it is not disabled js output My first thought was sizzle was falling back to QSA and the disabled selector where available and this was not working correctly in IE but QSA works correctly in IE9 Edge for this There seems to also be a related documentation issue as the docs say this always checks the disabled prop see jquery api jquery com 734

column2: Chrome Sandboxed App Unload is not available in packaged apps
column3: Originally reported by solgar at p Hi I have discovered that in the latest version of jQuery 2 1 1 I receive an error when I attempt to load it inside a sandbox in a Chrome App All that needs to be done to replicate it is to include jquery 2 1 1 inside the sandbox in the chrome app I have created an example app to replicate a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a p p The error appears to be related to some code that designed to apply for IE11 p p As far as I can tell this issue only generates the error when the app is loaded and it does not appear to affect my application All jQuery seems to still behave correctly inside and outside the sandbox p p I do not have this issue in chrome itself only when it is inside the sandbox of a chrome app Furthermore the issue is not in version 2 0 3 of jQuery so it was likely added in the 2 1 strain p p p p Issue reported for jQuery 2 1 1 p

column2: 7 Traversing Unit Tests suddenly failing in Microsoft Edge
column3: It appears something has changed in the master branch of JQuery that is causing the following unit tests to fail when run in Microsoft Edge traversing find String traversing find String under non elements traversing find leading combinator traversing find node jQuery object traversing is String undefined traversing is jQuery traversing is with has selectors All of the failures give the following message Died on test 1 at Global code jquery test unit traversing js 234 1 Permission denied When running tests for all modules from the master branch in the last week of November all of the above tests pass However when running tests for all modules from the master branch on December 4th all of the above tests fail Both times I used the same build of Windows 10 and with the Same Build of Microsoft Edge so the change appears to be coming from JQuery Note that these tests do not fail when run in isolation or when just running the traversal module Instead it appears they are dependent on the failure of test selector Iframe dispatch should not affect jQuery This test was failing previously in Microsoft Edge as well however now when it fails the traversing tests that follow it also fail as well

column2: Firefox do not set e relatedTarget to null on focusout
column3: On focusout event object the relatedTarget property tells which element is obtaining the focus In Chrome relatedTarget null only when no other element obtains the focus a click on the page background Firefox does not have a focusout event so it is faked by jQuery But the relatedTarget is not well set by jQuery it is always set to null A better solution would be to set relatedTarget to null only when we know that no other element obtains the focus undefined when we can not know if or which element obtains the focus This way when relatedTarget undefined we are either in an old browser that has not a complete implementation of the focusout event like Safari 5 1 or we are in a faked event that cannot tell which element obtains the focus And when relatedTarget null we can be certain that a focusout event has happened but no other element is obtaining the focus JSFiddle where you can test the values of e relatedTarget jQuery bug focusout relatedTargetset to null

column2: Chaining on broken for null handlers in jQuery 2 2 0 inconsistency with 1 12 0
column3: It looks like a bug was introduced in jquery 2 2 0 with the 'on' function If you have code that registers a bunch of handlers in a chain and one of the callbacks is null the on function will return the window object when the callback is null which causes the chaining to fail This works with jquery 2 1 4 After a little investigation it looks like the 'on' method was refactored to be global within jquery is scope and returns this which used to be the jquery object but now is window example from jquery impromptu plugin ' selector' on keydown keyDownEventHandler on 'impromptu loaded' opts loaded on 'impromptu close' opts close on 'impromptu statechanging' opts statechanging on 'impromptu statechanged' opts statechanged

column2: Remove right hand side specificity recommendation
column3: In you say Be specific on the right hand side of your selector and less specific on the left I have opened a thread on SO and done some benchmarks Basically in modern browsers supporting queryselectorall as far as I'm aware the Sizzle engine is not used for processing the selector And the way modern browsers unlike Sizzle evaluate selectors is left to right Thus being specific on the right hand side can hurt rather than help performance The right hand side should be treated with the same rules as the left hand side having less specificity Correct me if I'm wrong

column2: Hidden attribute solution for show hide toggle
column3: A simpler solution for show hide toggle based on the HTML5 hidden attribute To avoid ambiguity regarding how to write CSS to ensure hidden elements should be hidden the hidden attribute value is set to hidden instead of empty This solution is more in line with best practices regarding how to show hide elements as it leaves it up to the author to ensure it is hidden properly via CSS essentially the same as the class based recommendation removing adding classes to control display It will also leave the inline style intact in case this is needed to overrule jQuery is toggling For responsive web sites this will also provide a better way to control whether or not the element should be shown as it can be controlled through the hidden attribute selector within the context being styled Not to mention this probably performs better than having to remember the computed styles and resetting these when showing the element Another option is to add a method unhide that removes the hidden attribute whereas show retains the functionality of the current code where its inline style is changed to force it to show

column3: The Microsoft Edge team noticed the following test failure in Edge from test unit support js Verify that support tests resolve as expected per browser If you are running the tests locally I isolated the test with the query param testId e1b3f3c8 Previous versions of Edge and IE had a bug in which cloning an element and then clearing the cloned element is style would also clear the original element is style See 886 for an excellent and thorough analysis Turns out somewhere along the line Edge fixed this bug but the unit tests expect Edge to fail still I have copied the code from support js L20 L20 that tests the browser for this bug into a jsbin snippet console If you run it in Edge you can now see that jQuery determines support clearCloneStyle true

column2: Please provide a function for escaping special characters in selectors
column3: Originally reported by fejesjoco at p I read this article a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a p p It says plain and simple that a colon and a period must be escaped And then the example code also escapes square brackets so there is a problem already In the future you may add a new special character for a cool new selector feature and that will be a breaking change p p I can see already how many bugs have been filed about special characters in selectors and then closed as being documented I understand it completely This is not a bug report this is a feature request p p Please provide a function for escaping special characters in selectors Benefits p ul li it is a very easy utility function to implement and useful in many cases li li all those people who never cared about such issues will realize they should use this escaping mechanism li li all those people who used to run into problems with special characters before used to file all those unnecessary bugs now they will have an out of the box solution instead li li if a spec changes or jQuery API changes it wo not be a breaking change because the updated escape function would handle the new cases too li li the quoted documentation suggests to copy paste some code into my own JS but jQuery is about helping eliminate those kinds of code pieces it would be great to have it embedded li ul p I also realized there are much more characters which could need escaping if we are not just talking about the restricted ID is a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a This proposed escape function could handle that as well I hope it is not a problem if it unnecessarily escapes characters in a selector in cases when it is not needed p p Issue reported for jQuery 1 10 2 p

column2: Browser support for 4 x
column3: I have seen there is a milestone for 4 0 0 set up and I would love to know the planned browser support I have developed Umbrella JS a jquery alternative for fun and learning and I would love to contribute to jquery some of the things that I learned One of jquery is main advantage and in my opinion handicaps is browser support since it makes the source code much bigger While 3 0 0 Alpha was released in July 2015 and Beta just now in Jan 2016 can I assume that version 4 0 0 would not be ready for at least 1 2 years If that is the case seeing that browser usage of IE10 halves every year desktop mobile tablet browser version partially combined ww monthly 201301 201601 and that Microsoft dropped support for those browsers recently I propose to make jQuery 4 x release support only IE11 This way a lot of modern features could be brought in and reduce greatly the browser specific code and hacks A simple example of the possible benefits can be seen in addClass For modern browsers Umbrella JS it can be reduced to this

column2: Reduce jquery is size
column3: TL DR I would love to help reducing jquery is size while keeping the same performance and compatibility I am the creator of Umbrella JS made as a lightweight jquery alternative for modern browsers I started javascript with jquery many years ago and I would love to contribute back few things I have learned to try to reduce jquery is size While reading jquery is code I have realized that there is many things made in that way in the name of performance however modern browsers and engines are very different Take for example the while loop vs forEach or reduce that is traditionally considered a performance improvement However now both of these methods are at the same speed within margin error as jsperf shows jsperf test While they are similar speed the second one could really help addClass and other Class methods since the function itself could be put at the beginning similarly to getClass and get reused slimming down the code With all this said I would love to try to contribute back cleaning reducing and reusing as much source code as possible in jquery I have a couple of questions though Is this a wanted improvement The last thing I would want is to waste jquery is developers time and my time doing something that no one calling the shots is concerned about How do I test jquery is performance Are there currently performance tests I'm willing to try to add some but I would need some help setting this up Manually testing each and every change in jsperf is not viable not reproducible I have some setup in Umbrella JS L64 to run in Circle CI PS there was some discussion going on in issue 2887

column2: offset adds scrollTop to the top coordinate only in IE and jQuery 1 12 0 and 2 2 0
column3: Context I'm a collaborator in the jQuery UI Month Picker project Recently we have setup a demo page where we have used the latest compat version of jQuery 1 12 0 The plugin allows the user to click a button that uses the jQuey UI position method to position a menu under an input field As demonstrated in this page everything worked fine except for Internet Explorer which seems to positions the menu as far below the input as you scrolled IMPORTANT This only happens the first time after you position an element but you can reproduce the issue by refreshing the page What have I tried At first I thought this had something to do with the jQuery UI version 1 11 4 we were using but switching to several different versions of jQuery UI did not solve the issue Then I tried to use jQuery version 1 11 3 and everything is working fine even in IE I than tried version 1 9 1 which we run our tests month picker development kit against and once again everything worked find I also tried a different version 1 9 2 of jQuery UI with jQuery 1 9 1 and everything worked fine Then I tried to use jQuery version 2 2 0 and one again everyting was working fine except for IE What is going on in the code When the user clicks the button the Open method L567 in our code is called The open method calls the fadeToggle fadeToggle options method using the start callback option The start callback is called right after the dispaly none is removed and right before the animation begins which as mentioned in the jQuery ui position docs is required for it to work Our start callback L775 calls jQuery UI is position method which eventually will call elem offset L336 Eventually the jQuery offset setOffset L35 method calls elem offset to get the elements offset Eventually the elem offset method calls rect elem getBoundingClientRect L101 which seems to add scrollTop to the top property return by getBoundingClientRect TLDR I'm not sure if the problem is a result of us doing something wrong which just happens to work in every different configuration we have tested or is this an issue with jQuery that needs to be resolved

column2: IE9 pseudo selectors
column3: Under ie9 when using a pseudo selector library jQuery executes the selector on every element on the page even though it was given an id for the element ' id in viewport' causes in viewport to be executed on every element on the page ' id' is ' in viewport' obviously does not This is a huge performance issue under IE9 This does not happen under chrome and likely under other browsers I unfortunately do not have the expertise in jQuery to determine where exactly the issue lies so I cannot provide a patch at this moment However I would suspect that this would be a great performance optimization for older browsers where if the CSS selector is given an ID it first searches by that instead of executing the pseudo selector code I tested this in IE9 windows 7 Also tested in Chrome 42 on GNU Linux arch jQuery version 1 11 2 Yes I realize that I'm talking about a 3rd party add on for jQuery I do not think it is the issue since the method defined for the in viewport inviewport is being called different numbers of times depending on browser version In IE9 it gets called hundreds of times with elements that are not the one specified by ID Under chrome it is just the element specified by ID It appears to be how jQuery handles ID selectors The use case I have is a site with an infinite stream of items I need to do something as the cards come into the viewport I have a list of IDs for the cards so I iterate over the IDs and run the in viewport pseudo selector on them I have a list of 30 ids that gets pared down when each item has entered the view port Under IE performance was abysmal running in viewport 30 times should not be too terrible and indeed it is not unless you are on IE9

column2: e preventDefault is undefined
column3: In commit b4be64dd9b3207e68ac5095389285f3538ed81a6 the check to ensure that e preventDefault exists was defined was removed on line 691 I believe that though it may seem to be redundant guards there are no checks in place to ensure that the original event is actually an event that conforms with the expectations of an event namely containing a preventDefault method rather than just a JSON object that contains the bare minimum For example a bare minimum originalEvent may look like this pulled from jQuery Mobile is method However in the case that jQuery Mobile is used a call to the jQuery mobile Navigator go function creates a jQuery Event popstate that has an originalEvent that does not contain a preventDefault method Thus when jQuery Event preventDefault is called the originalEvent check fails to detect that the event does not in fact have a preventDefault function This may be an issue that needs to be addressed on the jQuery Mobile side But I traced it back to here and historically the check existed which causes this issue to pop up on newer versions of jQuery with jQuery Mobile

column2: Attributes remove the lower casing logic for attribute names
column3: jQuery used to lower case the attribute names passed to the attr setter to workaround an old IE issue This is no longer in jQuery 3 0 and removing it may even accidentally make this API sort of work on SVGs see gh 2910 so why not Manual lowercasing had to be added to the place where the proper attrHook is retrieved so that it works regardless of the casing of the provided name A regular toLowerCase is enough there as those few attributes do not contain any non ASCII characters Fixes gh 2914 18 bytes

column2: ajax does not emit textStatus 'timeout' error when a 504 Gateway Timeout occurred
column3: When 504 error occurred callback error is parameter textStatus is just an 'error' prototype error function jqXHR jqXHR String textStatus String errorThrown textStatus should be 'timeout' according to the RFC2616 is description for 504 error Though there is some conflicts when I try to comprehend how jQuery ajax should do when there is a gateway timeout in jQuery API documentation error Type Function jqXHR jqXHR String textStatus String errorThrown A function to be called if the request fails The function receives three arguments The jqXHR object a string describing the type of error that occurred and an optional exception object if one occurred Possible values for the second argument besides null are timeout error abort and parsererror When an HTTP error occurs errorThrown receives the textual portion of the HTTP status such as Not Found or Internal Server Error As of jQuery 1 5 Note This handler is not called for cross domain 504 Gateway Timeout error usually occurs when it use a long time pending request to wait for some events but there is a proxy reverse proxy especially reverse proxy such as nginx vhost That means once the proxy configuration of gateway set a smaller timeout limit than the browser or ajax is timeout option never a timeout error can get Here is part of RFC2616 Hypertext Transfer Protocol HTTP 1 1 sec10 5 5 for reference 10 5 5 504 Gateway Timeout The server while acting as a gateway or proxy did not receive a timely response from the upstream server specified by the URI e g HTTP FTP LDAP or some other auxiliary server e g DNS it needed to access in attempting to complete the request

column2: Standardize custom pseudo object
column3: cc The Sizzle pseudos object is exposed on jQuery expr as three distinct properties jQuery expr pseudos jQuery expr filters jQuery expr Sizzle defines the first two and jQuery defines the third None of them appear in the current jQuery documentation though Sizzle documents the object as pseudos sizzleselectorspseudosname function elem and separately documents the related setFilters sizzleselectorssetfilterslowercase name function elements argument not and I'm sure we have published instructions on how to define a custom pseudo at least once which would necessarily reference one of them We also have internal uses in at least two libraries core defines jQuery expr from jQuery expr pseudos defines hidden visible and animated by extending jQuery expr filters calls jQuery expr filters hidden in the visible pseudo UI defines data focusable tabbable and widget pseudos by extending expr replaces the animated filter at expr filters animated calls expr filters visible and expr filters hidden So now that this issue affects three source repositories and jquery api jquery com here is the crux of it can we standardize on one internally and deprecate the others All things considered my vote would be on filters

column2: Eliminate the intro outro nuisance tickets
column3: Good news The development best practice of using JSHint or ESLint to check source files is becoming a lot more common now Bad news People are running JSHint and ESLint on jQuery source files and getting error messages on intro js and outro js since they are not actually complete files Examples are 2747 2819 2953 and I think based on Google Translate 2971 We should be able to fix this by changing the extension of those two files from js to js partial or some such That way they wo not be linted by default and the name should provide a clue that they are not complete files

column2: Cannot set val for select options containing tabs t
column3: I have a select element that contains options whose values contain tab characters My original use case was a trailing tab string t but I have also tested with leading tabs tstring and tabs in the middle of non whitespace str ting I called val 'value with tab' on the select element and expected the corresponding option to be selected since the values are identical but no option is selected A few interesting observations I can work around this issue for the leading and trailing cases by removing the leading or trailing tab characters from the string I pass to val but this is unexpected since the values do not match exactly Removing a middle tab character and passing that to val does not select the value so there is no workaround for strings that have tab characters in the middle The behavior is the same with jquery 2 2 1 3 0 0 alpha1 and edge With jquery 1 12 1 the leading and trailing tabs have the bug behavior but having a tab in the middle of the word and passing a matching string with a tab in the middle works as expected so there was a regression at some point in this case JSFiddle You will see in the console what I expect the behavior to be compared to what the behavior actually is I searched for tab and whitespace and did not see anything directly relevant I did find this issue but it only mentions IE10 and I am seeing the unexpected behavior in Firefox 44 and Chrome 48

column2: Over event is not propagated if nested droppable does not accept draggable under a certain scenario
column3: The steps below are applicable to the following jsFiddle Steps 1 Click on and drag Draggable 1 onto the inner droppable of Droppable 3 Continue to hold Draggable 1 do not release it 2 Note that when Draggable 1 is on the inner droppable and the pointer is fully over the area of Droppable 3 the outer Droppable 3 is highlighted which is expected 3 Move Draggable 1 beyond the bounds of Droppable 3 and release it so that it is resting entirely in whitespace 4 Click and drag Draggable 2 You only have to drag it to some random whitespace spot not on a droppable 5 Release Draggable 2 6 Grab Draggable 1 again and drag it onto the inner droppable of Draggable 3 Continue to hold Draggable 1 do not release it 7 When Draggable 1 is on the inner droppable and the pointer is fully over the area of Droppable 3 take a note of the state of the outer Droppable 3 container Expected results The outer Droppable 3 container is highlighted when Draggable 1 is entirely on the inner droppable and within the bounds of Droppable 3 Actual results The outer Droppable 3 container is not highlighted when Draggable 1 is entirely on the inner droppable and within the bounds of Droppable 3 Notes If you debug the issue it turns out that simply dragging Draggable 2 results in some state changes in Droppable 3 such that event propagation no longer works as expected when Droppable 1 is on the inner droppable Console logs have been added to this jsFiddle to help highlight this issue

column2: When an error thrown from ready handler all subsequent handlers are not being invoked
column3: Jquery version 2 1 1 Browser on any browser Testcase Please take a look at this jsfiddle Example with jquery2 1 1 Example with jquery1 5 where it works fine Edit OLD and improper test case Problem When an error is thrown from one of the handlers registered through docuement ready then all subsequent handler are not being invoked Addl info This is what happening when an error is thrown from a handler function which is registered with ready jQuery Callbacks fire refer line 3073 in jquery 2 1 1 js will invoke the user is ready Handler function Below is related piece of code When an error was thrown firing flag will not be reset to false Due to this any handlers registered after error will not be triggered refer line 3113 in jquery 2 1 1 js firing true for list firingIndex firingLength firingIndex if list firingIndex apply data 0 data 1 false options stopOnFalse this statement invokes our ready handler memory false To prevent further calls using add break firing false It looks like firing flag need to be reset in a finally block Workaround Obvious workaround is handler code need to be wrapped with try catch to avoid this issue

column2: Custom builds use different ready code when excluding Deferred
column3: Modules depending on deferred are excluded when deferred is excluded ajax effects queue and core ready Whenever deferred is excluded core ready is replaced by core ready no deferred jQuery ready promise has been removed and jQuery ready made a thenable in core ready 1823 error resiliency has been addressed by giving up our synchronicity guarantee in ready handler execution after the ready event has been fired This has multiple advantages Besides error resiliency it makes use of our standards compatible then in the ready method

column2: Exposing filter pseudo functions for use with elements directly
column3: Very often I am wanting to get access to common pseudo methods such as focus selected checked or empty etc for a single target element in an event callback For that I currently have two options 1 Either write my own code duplicating jQuery is failsafe methods Which seems redundant 2 Wrap the element into jQuery and use the fn is peudo selector Both are however wasteful of resources Given that those methods taking a single element argument are already in the code base They have a legit case to be used directly But they are not exposed Could they be exposed to an is set of functions as well It would allow simple efficient checks like is focus el without having to go through creating a new object and runs regex exprs needlessly

column2: Commit to how disconnected elements toggle
column3: Ref issuecomment 172993424 toggle uses the newly renamed isHiddenWithinTree to determine whether a show or hide is called for and effects methods use it to determine if they should invoke a preliminary show But since isHiddenWithinTree does not yet perform exactly as advertised all disconnected elements are treated as hidden In code jQuery div a div find addBack toggle locks in inline defaultDisplay values for both elements as does visible detach toggle appendTo inPageParent This is counterintuitive to me especially when it comes to element descendants like the above a I would propose updating isHiddenWithinTree to use only inline display values when evaluating disconnected elements Other possibilities include a treating elements differently by parent document or element vs document fragment or null please no and b keeping everything as is But no matter what we should either add unit tests asserting the consensus decision or document that disconnected elements are invalid context for the methods

column2: License tags
column3: The jquery javascript files that users run should be tagged as free software so that people who want to run only free software on the web could do so jQuery is free software might be free software but since it is not tagged as such you have to either allow all proprietary javascript as well or just not run jQuery LibreJS is a project by GNU to make it possible for those who want to run only free software on their browsers to only allow files that are free software PS The license file on jquery org and rest of the page for that matter is completely unaccessible from Tor

column2: jQuery 3 0 breaks the jQuery Easing plugin
column3: The jQuery Easing Plugin has been around since 2008 and seems to be heavily used Even the npm downloads are pretty high The changes we made in 3 0 break this plugin because the plugin needlessly AFAICT uses the deprecated removed args There are several ways to address this but the easiest would be to update the plugin would you accept a PR for this Github repo

column2: Remove default Deferred callback context
column3: I ran into an interesting obstacle when working on 3029 our longstanding behavior of using a default context for jQuery Deferred callbacks specifically the deferred is base promise console It is not necessarily a blocker but it does make when Deferred resolve done whatsMyContext very counterintuitive in that I'm not even sure what to code for 3029 For sanity in that case and for increased similarity with native Promises I would like to remove the default making With methods required to provide a meaningful context In other words the preceding code would have either undefined or global object context depending on whether or not it was executed in strict mode Any objections

column2: Make event dispatch optimizable by engines
column3: The event dispatch method is not optimizable by modern JS engines This is especially crucial if a lot of events are dispatched mousemove and touchmove come to mind no param reassign Fixed by not reassigning function param dont pass arguments Fixed by not pass arguments object to other Array slice Now optimizable by v8 spidermonkey and most probably all the other engines optimizable o

column2: Add traditional param to serialize
column3: As a result of gh 3030 we will soon be properly ignoring jQuery ajaxSettings traditional in jQuery param as we said we did back in 1 8 The intent is to make serialize js independent of ajax settings which is good but now there is no way for serialize to specify the traditional flag at all Since it accepts no args at the moment we could add traditional as an arg and pass it down to jQuery param that way Ref Edited serializeArray does not need changing

column2: when should always be synchronous when possible
column3: IIC jQuery 3 0 will have then be A compatible in that callbacks are always executed out of context e g with setTimeout while done will continue to be executed synchronously whenever possible eager I was double checking that when kept the eager behavior and discovered that it does unless there is a single argument I was hope to get ABCD given that the promised is already resolved when the done are called and dreaded ADBC if when was no longer eager I get worse though Console is ACDB which is not acceptable when p and when p p should behave the exact same way FWIW I personally disagree with Promise A is rule 2 2 4 and I hope jQuery keeps all behavior eager except for then to comply with A and gives us an eager version of then could be pipe but with the correct semantics for callbacks return values I did not investigate any further but it looks related to 3059

column2: Remove jQuery event fix performance bottleneck
column3: Every native event has to go through jQuery event fix to copy and normalize properties that go into the jQuery Event object passed to handlers There is a tension between minimizing the number of items copied for performance reasons versus making more of them available directly so that users wo not be forced to get them via event originalEvent See further discussion in gh 2860 and gh 1746

column2: jQuery event fix may force layout
column3: Originally reported by anonymous at p Accessing some of the event properties while copying them like tt jQuery event fix tt does in tt event prop originalEvent prop tt at a class ext link href L511 rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span L511 a may force style recalculation and layout p p Screenshots of Timeline in Chrome Developer Tools a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a a class ext link href rel nofollow span class icon nbsp span a p p Issue reported for jQuery 1 10 2 p

column2: Event change fixHooks propHooks to ES5 getter methods
column3: removes the copy loop in jQuery event fix avoids accessing properties such as client offset page screen X Y which may cause style recalc or layouts This is a potential solution for 1746 also mentioned using this for 2337 This also removes the slow even if no layout is forced loop from fix The main problems with this approach getter properties are slow but unless you call them N times still faster then today is fix loop and fixes 1746 putting getter properties on the prototype means event hasOwnProperty eventProp is false EDIT this is actually what native events do so this is probably a good thing Potential changes to this approach drop the setter part normally faster except when the getter is called X times create jQuery MouseEvent and jQuery KeyboardEvent so properties like shiftKey are only on keyboard events only use getters for properties which might force a layout and keep the fix loop for copying other properties requires new getter properties API

column2: MouseEvent pageX pageY fill is not needed in jQuery 3 0
column3: Related to Original comment issuecomment 215337185 MouseEvent pageX pageY also might be influenced L435 If native event do not have pageX Y these are calculated using clientLeft clientTop If html element has border width 10px like the example above in a browser that does not support event pageX Y and correct clientTop clientLeft jQuery returns 10 10 as pageX Y when mouse is positioned at left top corner of body In a browser that returns correct clientTop clientLeft jQuery returns 0 0 as pageX Y I feel that 10 10 is correct result But I do not know recent browser that does not support event pageX Y Since Firefox returns 0 as clientTop clientLeft of html element always MouseEvent pageX pageY might be incorrect When native event object does not have pageX Y jQuery event mouseHooks filter calculates these using document documentElement clientLeft clientTop i e border width of html element But I do not know recent browser that does not support event pageX Y Represent This simulates a browser that does not support event pageX Y Chrome m ch IE m ie Firefox m ff incorrect result in Firefox by its bug but I think pageX 10 pageY 10 is correct result That is jQuery event mouseHooks filter should not subtract clientTop clientLeft

column2: Event Remove pageX pageY fill for event object
column3: Summary Fixes gh 3092 IE8 was the last major browser missing these Support elsewhere looks good according to Our existing unit tests for them are pretty sparse L2437 2456 but they did catch when the properties were left off the list Creating fake events with predefined pageX Y wo not help our ability to determine whether the browser values are correct Docs issue is not needed because we will still be copying them Checklist Mark an x for completed items if you are not sure leave them unchecked and we can assist x All authors have signed the CLA at New tests have been added to show the fix or feature works x Grunt build and unit tests pass locally with these changes If needed a docs issue PR was created at Thanks Bots and humans will be around shortly to check it out

column2: Event handlers with invalid selectors should be caught at attach time
column3: Otherwise they become very difficult to debug See this jsfiddle for an example Attaching an event handler with an invalid selector div not causes an exception to be raised at event time This makes it very difficult to debug as the trace of the error will usually only include jquery code I suggest jQuery should throw an exception at attach time instead which makes it fairly easy to detect the faulty code

column2: Event evaluate selector at add time
column3: Summary This ensures events with invalid selectors throw at attach time instead of event time This is done by instantiating a Sizzle for the selector jQuery find is used instead of jQuery find matchesSelector as suggested in issuecomment 213254660 because matchesSelector requires a DOMElement which wo not be if the element is actually document Fixes 3071 Checklist Mark an x for completed items if you are not sure leave them unchecked and we can assist x All authors have signed the CLA at x New tests have been added to show the fix or feature works x Grunt build and unit tests pass locally with these changes If needed a docs issue PR was created at Thanks Bots and humans will be around shortly to check it out

column2: Element which is not in page still visible in IE8
column3: Hi I'm having an issue with the visible hidden check giving the wrong result in IE8 when the element under test is not in the page A simplified testcase is the following snippet ' div Test div ' is ' visible' In all browsers the result of this is false because the element is not in the page except in IE8 for which it actually is true From what I have investigated it seems like the issue is the final return of the filterHidden function L19 I think this must check if the resulting node is a document fragment If it is a fragment the element can not be visible and the result must thus be true And there may possibly be different node types which could be the parent while the element is not actually in the page for which the test also returns the wrong result

column2: Deferred Give better stack diagnostics on exceptions
column3: Summary Ref gh 2736 The exception stack has the name of the immediately outer function where the exception occurred which can be very handy for tracing errors Since we already have the exception object we might as well use it I was debugging some code that had errors inside a document ready function and this would have been really useful to have Checklist Mark an x for completed items if you are not sure leave them unchecked and we can assist x All authors have signed the CLA at x New tests have been added to show the fix or feature works x Grunt build and unit tests pass locally with these changes If needed a docs issue PR was created at Thanks Bots and humans will be around shortly to check it out

column2: CSP Error and Jquery
column3: With CSP enabled in an web application and not allowing unsafe line styles the jquery library encounter and error which goes to the browser console The jquery library does handle have a fallback method when innerHTML is not possible so the application is functional just lots of false positives in the console My request is to have the library proactively check if it is allow to use innerHTML rather than just relying on the exception path to address this I am encountering this in Chrome on a Windows 7 machine Here is the content security policy configuration that results in the this warning Content Security Policy default src iself' style src iself' jquery js 5513 Refused to apply inline style because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive style src iself' Either the 'unsafe inline' keyword a hash isha256 IOWYPccv4 GIAWz50PQ4hgBzwty G8ckj9XrN5jdx6g ' or a nonce 'nonce ' is required to enable inline execution In Jquery 2 2 2 the line is 5513 and the content looks like EDIT by Fixed Markdown code formatting so that it is readable Feature Requests Please read Most features should start as plugins outside of jQuery Bug Reports Note that we only can fix bugs in the latest 1 x 2 x 3 x versions of jQuery Briefly describe the issue you have encountered What do you expect to happen What acually happens Which browsers are affected Provide a minimal test case see Use the latest shipping version of jQuery in your test case We prefer test cases on or Frequently Reported Issues Selectors with ' ' break See Description Link to test case

column2: Shim focusin focusout in all browsers
column3: Feature Requests Please read Most features should start as plugins outside of jQuery Bug Reports Note that we only can fix bugs in the latest 1 x 2 x 3 x versions of jQuery Briefly describe the issue you have encountered What do you expect to happen What acually happens Which browsers are affected Provide a minimal test case see Use the latest shipping version of jQuery in your test case We prefer test cases on or Frequently Reported Issues Selectors with ' ' break See Description If focusout blur handlers are attached on one input and focusin focus on the second one the order of events fired by jQuery is 1 focusout 2 blur 3 focusin 4 focus The order mandated by the spec h events focusevent event order and followed by IE 11 is 1 focusout 2 focusin 3 blur 4 focus EDIT IE is not following the spec though as it fires only focusout focusin synchronously and blur focus asynchronously This has been fixed in Edge and now all events are fired synchronously as in other browsers The spec also mandates that focus is lost after focusout before blur and gained after focusin but before focus event fires Chrome Safari do the following 1 blur 2 focusout 3 focus 4 focusin Edge 13 does the following 1 focusout 2 blur 3 focus 4 focusin Firefox does not support those events yet but there is ongoing work in We are currently polyfilling this event everywhere except in IE Since IE differs from our implementation and it is an obsolete browser it sounds bad to let it do its own thing different than what we have Should we just shim everywhere Link to test case

column2: Delay in submit
column3: Feature Requests Please read Most features should start as plugins outside of jQuery Bug Reports Note that we only can fix bugs in the latest 1 x 2 x 3 x versions of jQuery Briefly describe the issue you have encountered What do you expect to happen What acually happens Which browsers are affected Provide a minimal test case see Use the latest shipping version of jQuery in your test case We prefer test cases on or Frequently Reported Issues Selectors with ' ' break See Description Using the latest versions as of 5 18 16 1 12 3 and 2 2 3 and also the latest jQuery validate files On a simple form of 9 fields 5 input and 4 select boxes with validation around it during a jQuery submit I am noticing a 3 5 4 5 second delay in the triggering of the submit Doing testing and using FireBug I was able to locate the line of code that was slowly down the system myform500002 submit The chunk of code in question was This section was causing a delay in processing When changing from the above code to the following code validator setDefaults submitHandler function var formname 'myform500002' document formname submit The form submitted almost immediately 1 second delay I would account for the delay for the submission of the code on the server The jQuery submit process is slow while a javascript submit is much faster Link to test case I do not have an external link to the code but if you need the source code I can post that Thanks

column2: Selector of input with attribute value xxx does not take changes via val function into account
column3: I think there is a problem in jQuery 1 9 0 as the selector of value is not taking into account the value set by the val function of jQuery I'm not sure that it is by design or not but it seems like a bug If you set a value of a text box via input text val newValue then the selector of jQuery is not taking this change into account So the input text value 'newValue' returns nothing You can check the difference in the following links jQuery 1 9 jQuery 1 8 3 Normally I would expect change with val function to be reflected on the value attribute of the input as well Which seems reasonable

column2: JQ3 0 RC1 Deferred notify progress callback getting the wrong params

column2: Studying the evolution of JQuery is project
column3: Hi there I'm a researcher studying software evolution As part of my current research I'm studying the implications of open sourcing a proprietary software for instance if the project succeed in attracting newcomers JQuery was in my list To further analyze the impacts of JQuery s migration we analyzed the git log commit history of your project in terms of number of contributions number of newcomers and number of contributors per month The following figure presents a temporal perspective regarding these three measures jquery Given the numbers presented in the graphic we would like to ask JQuery developers the following questions 1 What motivated the project to open its source code at Github How do you evaluate the benefits of this migration 2 Does this snapshot make sense Did you find any inconsistency on the data 3 Do you have any internal policy to promote attract retain newcomers If so do them succeed 4 Why there was a slope on the number of newcomers that joined the project Thanks in advance for your collaboration Gustavo Pinto PhD

column2: Boolean attribute getters throw if the attribute name is not all lowercase
column3: Feature Requests Please read Most features should start as plugins outside of jQuery Bug Reports Note that we only can fix bugs in the latest 1 x 2 x 3 x versions of jQuery Briefly describe the issue you have encountered What do you expect to happen What acually happens Which browsers are affected Provide a minimal test case see Use the latest shipping version of jQuery in your test case We prefer test cases on or Frequently Reported Issues Selectors with ' ' break See Description In 2916 we removed our logic that lowercased attribute names This caused one regression any attribute getter using a name for boolean attributes but not all lowercased is going into an infinite recursion exceeding the stack call limit Amongst others this is breaking the AngularJS test suite when tested with jQuery 3 0 0 rc1 Link to test case Basically ' div ' attr arequiRed' is enough to trigger the error

column2: Add support for JSPM sfx bundles
column3: Feature Request Does it require access to jQuery internals Yes it does The problem seems to be in the way jQuery is exported Can jQuery itself benefit from the feature Yes it does jQuery can be used in more development and production environments Is the feature related to DOM operations No Is the need already served by a plugin No Does it change an existing API No Does it support best practice Yes Description In my project to create our widget bundles we are using jspm jspm cli As they are widgets we want our code as isolated as possible so we use jspm sfx bundles that you can create using The problem is that if this packages does not add a define or require to the global and when jQuery wants to export itself it decides that needs to be on the global Overwriting the jQuery we have in the page we have a lot of issues Link to test case If we use Webpack Dev Server it does not happens

column2: then improperly propagates progress from locked in Deferred
column3: When then locks in a Deferred by rebinding to a thenable resolved by its base progress context is inappropriately propagated as progress data and progress data is in appropriately wrapped in an array It is probably easier to explain in code than in natural language This happens because notify is used where notifyWith belongs at deferred js L131 L131

column2: Deferred Propagate progress correctly from unwrapped promises
column3: Summary Progress parameters are now correctly propagated from a deferred to which another deferred resolved unwrapping it Thanks to for the report and a clear description of the problem and the needed fix Fixes gh 3062 I would like to get it in 3 0 0 as this bug is really unexpected and we have had a related external report Please review core Checklist Mark an x for completed items if you are not sure leave them unchecked and we can assist x All authors have signed the CLA at x New tests have been added to show the fix or feature works x Grunt build and unit tests pass locally with these changes x If needed a docs issue PR was created at Thanks Bots and humans will be around shortly to check it out

column2: Bootstrap 3 unit test fail with SVG element
column3: This test L1042 1079 from Bootstrap 3 the current version fails on Chrome and Safari but passes on IE Edge and Firefox Our getClientRects call inside offset L96 101 returns a length of zero on those browsers but getBoundingClientRect seems to work fine It is a relatively edgy case and this unit test is not present in Bootstrap 4 but given the way it fails it is not something that can be easily worked around via Migrate for example I'm also worried that other code may be expecting to get offsets on SVG elements even though we have never officially supported it Would it work to check whether the current element is SVG perhaps and avoid the check for that case

column2: jQuery UI 1 11 4 position without specifying within gets error
column3: The jQuery UI position utility function dies with the new jQuery 3 when a wthin option is not specified The default for within is Window The position routine tries to use the offset routine of jQuery According to the new documentation use of Window to query offset will throw an error Excerpt from blog Error cases don t silently fail Perhaps in a profound moment you ve wondered What is the offset of a window Then you probably realized that is a crazy question how can a window even have an offset In the past jQuery has sometimes tried to make cases like this return something rather than having them throw errors In this particular case of asking for the offset of a window the answer up to now has been top 0 left 0 With jQuery 3 0 such cases will throw errors so that crazy requests aren t silently ignored Please try out this release and see if there is any code out there depending on jQuery to mask problems with invalid inputs My fix in jQuery ui image

column2: data function possible bug or stupid intend
column3: Feature Requests Please read Most features should start as plugins outside of jQuery Bug Reports Note that we only can fix bugs in the latest 1 x 2 x 3 x versions of jQuery Briefly describe the issue you have encountered What do you expect to happen What acually happens Which browsers are affected Provide a minimal test case see Use the latest shipping version of jQuery in your test case We prefer test cases on or Frequently Reported Issues Selectors with ' ' break See Description When using the data function then jQuery will get the attribute value if it does not exist and get the data and NOT attribute value if it does not exist Heres an example div data foo house div If you fire div data foo then it will return house That makes you believe that the data foo function is linked to the data foo attribute in the DOM So if you set it now like this div data foo bike Now you think that the data foo attribute value is bike haha thats not the case its still house So now to get the attribute data foo you need to write div attr data foo And to get the foo data in the code that i set then i need to go for div data foo That is EXTREMELY error prone because there could be name classes between the div data foo and the div attr data foo An example could be if you wanted to check if a key value pair is undefined in the data But it is defined if the DOM object has the attribute and it is undefined if it does not have that attribute I figured it out when i was coding and i expected something to be undefined but it was defined because i had the same data XXX attribute name as i had in the data XXX jQuery function And then all the bug hell broke lose Is this a bug or a stupid intend I think its very error prone Link to test case

column2: Locking issues to comments is a bad practice
column3: For example at issuecomment 225445829 The last comment is I do not think this discussion is going to resolve anything so I will lock the thread I have given the reasons why we do not provide detailed API violations and you disagree which is your right but it wo not change our approach Locking the issue to comments was totally unnecessary or at the very least premature The administrator here could have just made the same comment without locking the issue so I could have asked him what part exactly of the API guidelines he linked to is supposed to back his point In general locking an issue to comments is a very stupid thing to do It should be a last resort in extreme cases

column2: Fail callbacks receive wrong argument if deferreds are already rejected when passed to when
column3: Suppose a number of deferreds are passed to when and these deferreds are or will be rejected If a fail callback is added to when it should receive the argument which had been passed to the first failed deferred That is the behaviour in jQuery 2 and that is how it works in jQuery 3 as well with one exception In jQuery 3 the argument of the last failing deferred is passed to the callback if when receives the deferreds by the time they are already rejected For a working example including a comparison of jQuery 2 and 3 see js console

column3: Feature Requests Please read Most features should start as plugins outside of jQuery Bug Reports Note that we only can fix bugs in the latest 1 x 2 x 3 x versions of jQuery Briefly describe the issue you have encountered What do you expect to happen What acually happens Which browsers are affected Provide a minimal test case see Use the latest shipping version of jQuery in your test case We prefer test cases on or Frequently Reported Issues Selectors with ' ' break See Description Traceback reformatting breaks source maps it is unreadable compared to browser built in tracebacks and it cannot be folded closed like browser built in tracebacks Tracebacks are an essential development tool Breaking traceback is not an acceptable way to write libraries Closing tickets pointing out that jQuery breaks tracebacks does not fix tracebacks

column2: Setting the selected option using prop vs attr in IE11
column3: Hi all I'm having a problem selecting options and reading when using both prop and attr methods I reduced the problem to what could be seen in the following fiddler Basically after setting the property of all options to false I can not set a selected property using attr method and then read the select value with val The problem only occurs in IE11 I have not tried other versions While this may seem an odd thing to do I got here since I'm using different jQuery plugins to enhance my selects multiselect and picklist I can not programatically clean all selected options by using the prop method because later on the multiselect will not work anymore but I can not also just use the attr method since the multiselect uses the prop I'm not sure if this is a bug or simply a browser limitation or even the intended behavior Chrome and Firefox seem to handle that just fine I tried several different jQuery versions but without luck Thanks in advance for your help

column2: jQueryUI 1 11 4 position fails with jQuery 3 0 0
column3: The position method of jQueryUI fails with jQuery 3 0 0 jQuery dumps an error to console 'VM206 jquery 3 0 0 js 9779 Uncaught TypeError elem getClientRects is not a function' The problem seems to be with window which does not have this function and is used as the default for the within property if the object passed to position does not provide a within property where is is used in the jQuery 3 0 0 offset method It works okay if the 3 0 0 migrate plugin is loaded but this rather seems to be an incompatibility between the most recent jQuery and jQueryUI versions Using following Chrome Versie 51 0 2704 103 m 64 bit on Windows 10 also seems to fail on FireFox jQuery 3 0 0 jQueryUI 1 11 4

column2: filter parent selector returns empty array 3 0 0
column3: Expect to receive jQuery objects after method filter but returns empty Return correct array in previous version 2 1 4 js output

column2: html does not entity encode greater than character in attributes
column3: Description Per the WHATWG HTML5 spec attributes cannot contain the greater than character attributes 2 jQuery is html method does not respect this and should be changed to lt and gt respectively For that is actually not required by the standard but is more user friendly Tested on Chrome 50 0 2661 86 64 bit on Ubuntu 14 04 Link to test case

column2: css getting opacity value just after setting results in invalid value for iframe in Firefox
column3: Test Expected result alert with message PASSED e g in Chrome Firefox 40 0 3 result Expected opacity value is 0 but returned value is 1 jQuery versions 2 1 4 2 1 3 and all other available at jsfiddle result is the same OS Windows 7 x64 Test details Firstly opacity of the testDiv element is set to 0 testDiv css 'opacity' 0 Then value is received as testDiv css 'opacity' and it is not 0 which was set Did not try with another properties tried only with opacity Workarounds it works fine in the following tests 1 setTimeout before get call 2 jQuery free test 3 iframe free test

column2: Ready is much too late
column3: I like the idea of deprecating ready But it is broken in 3 0 0 A simple demo shows it triggers much too late Safari 10 shows Log 5 readyState interactive 2 3 load html line 26 Log 9 DOMContentLoaded fired 2 3 load html line 26 Log 9 readyState complete 2 3 load html line 26 Log 11 load fired 2 3 load html line 26 Log 625 ready fired 2 3 load html line 26 The other browsers show the same order but not as long a wait for ready

column2: Deferred Fix exceptions silent swallowing
column3: Summary Describe what this PR does All but trivial changes e g typos should start with an issue Mention the issue number here Currently jQuery silently swallows exceptions thrown in the body of a function passed as argument in the ready event handler For instance If no such function is provided code now outputs the exception error message in the console This fix works in all fn document ready fn and ready fn calls Note This fix is applied on the ready implementation not the ready not deferred one Fixes 3174 Checklist Mark an x for completed items if you are not sure leave them unchecked and we can assist All authors have signed the CLA at New tests have been added to show the fix or feature works x Grunt build and unit tests pass locally with these changes If needed a docs issue PR was created at Thanks Bots and humans will be around shortly to check it out
